text: Not much to complain about here. Good food on the east side of Madison with a good beer and drinks menu. I had the bison burger which was fantastic and got the side of cucumber cilantro quinoa. People I was with had skirt steak (again delicious) with garlic mashed potatoes (you guessed it....delicious).   Very nice wait staff and good homey kind of place. If I lived in Madison I would definitely come back to this place as a staple.

Based on the rave reviews, I caught Alchemy on the wrong day. The atmosphere was pleasant, but loud. I wasn't that hungry, and didn't feel like paying $10 for a sandwich. So I ordered the tomato basil soup, which was the special of the day and sounded delicious. The basil was fresh, as were at least part of the tomatoes. But the soup had a thick, almost chunky consistency that made me feel like I was eating a bowlful of marinara sauce. I seriously considered asking for a side of pasta. Instead, I sent my soup back half-uneaten, paid my bill, and left. I don't know if I'll be back, since the menu seemed pricey and I didn't see anything that really piqued my interest.

The Alchemy is a wonderful bar located in a fantastic neighborhood. The food is always fresh and tasty, the staff is extra-ordinarily friendly and the tap beers are always interesting. The choice of taps changes regularly, and they do a stellar job of choosing incredible beers for every palate. Try the sweet potato fries for a unique bar snack and the fish fry is to die for. Cheers to the Alchemy for knowing how to run a first rate, inexpensive and consistently tasty establishment! They are cash only, so leave your plastic at home.

I've been frequenting this bar for years.  Its just a short walk from my house.  Here's my overall take:  Pros: -Good burgers made with organic meat -Reasonable prices -nice beer selection (a plus for my husband) -the desserts are FANTASTIC! -Food service till midnight  Cons: -doesn't accept cards (not even debit cards, who's fees are nominal compared to credit cards) -when busy service tends to take a dive -I've tried a few of the other sandwiches (the fried walleye and the BLFT) and they were less than stellar  Overall, If you come in with enough cash and order a burger you'll probably leave happy.

I'm so thankful to have Alchemy in my neighborhood.  Their sweet potato fries are amazing.  A trip to Alchemy wouldn't be complete without them.  They do a great job of sourcing a lot of their products, particularly meat, locally, and their specials often feature seasonal ingredients.  I have yet to find a menu item that I haven't been really, really happy with.  This is always where we bring out of town friends. They have an ever-changing excellent beer selection - lots of unique, hard to find brews - and the servers are usually quite knowledgeable about them.  The place also has a nice vibe.  The only less-than-ideal experience we had is on a Friday night.  We had to wait for quite some time to get a table only to find out that, because of their friday fish fry (though I hear it's great), they don't make sweet potato fries on Friday.  And as I said, a trip to Alchemy isn't complete without the sweet potato fries.
Great service, food, and local brews. The wasabi green beans, Gorgonzola ranch, and hot wings were fantastic. Cool atmosphere as well

Yes, it is a hipster hangout, which can be a good or bad thing (depending on who you are).  However, the drinks (old fashioned, especially) and food are phenomenal.  They buy local and step outside the box on dishes...two things both my husband and I appreciate.  Also, the prices are not bad for the size of plates and quality.
wish i could give you ten stars. awesome. amazing. so yummm. one of the best meals i have ever had. sweet poato fries. blt w/ green beans. local. fresh. super great.

Pretty good place. First visit tonight, not something to write home about but not the worst either. First, the atmosphere can be quite loud like you would expect from a bar. It fills up in there so come early or you will be waiting. Wear layers because its quite warm inside. The door offers a blast if cold air every now and then but overall warm. Carry cash or have your ATM card- they do have an ATM in the bar with only 1.00 fee so nothing outrageous. Service was very slow. We asked for a straw with the water, never saw that. Also they do not have steak sauce so inward told I could get their homemade version, didn't see that either. It took quite a while for someone to notice we needed a box and bring the check. The food, only bright spot in my visit. Excellent fish fry & hanger steak.  I am sure I will return at some point but not my go-to spot.

fresh food? NO. Who was cooking Friday Oct 16 early evening 430ish? Sweet potato fries were burned black and gross. Coconut curry was dry and obviously a left-over batch. friend's burger was NOT made to order(medium-rare), instead was dry and burned in areas. Guess we should've sent things back but one always feels bad for the waitress.  Won't be giving this place my money again.
Solid bar food, and by solid I mean heavy and solid food. Amazing rotating beer taps--drink something you like on monday, it will likely be gone forever when you go back on wednesday.

In the last 3 years, this has been our go-to-place for fish fry Fridays. But the last several times I've been, the fish was not up to par. Fryer seems to be in need of cleaning after an hour of work because the fish come out a bit too dark. Also, in my last visit, we received half a portion of the fish fry order compared to a table neighbors who, right as we were leaving, we saw got their fish orders (our plates were literally half the size of theirs, and the amount of fish was also noticeably different ). not cool to charge the same for serving less and for the waitress to have served it that way.  Other than that, the food is ok (depends what you get. For example, cooks put a bit too much liquid smoke into their burgers. Place is noisy and not good for conversations. Staff is pleasant and always moving.

Wasabi green beans!!!!   I basically love everything on the menu here, but the Zaremba Burger is by far my favorite. Grass-fed beef? Yes, please. Bacon? Duh. Green olive and shallot salad and herb gorgonzola dressing? The best thing in the entire world.    This place gets really busy, so be prepared! They have a large bar, which is nice when you're waiting for a table. They also have full service at the bar, so if you can't get a table, feel free to indulge right there!   Another great dish you should try is the BLFT. It's a BLT with a fried tomato.  They could put anything they wanted on the sandwich just so long as it has bacon on it. Any meal that includes bacon is amazing and a must-have. I once saw a shirt that said "Exercise. Ex...er...cise. Ex...ar...size. Eggs...are...sides. For bacon. Bacon."  I feel like this is very accurate. :)

I was in town for the Wisconsin/BYU game that day with my gf and two other friends, and while we were driving in we had found this place on Yelp. Luckily we got in right before the rush because this place was packed within minutes after we sat down! The beer selection was great, highly recommend the Amber Ale they had on tab, just plain delicious. This was my first time in the area as I'm from NJ, so getting cheese curds was an absolute must. They were great, very lightly fried, bite size pieces that were easy to eat and enjoy. I ended up getting the Turkey burger there, which was just flat out incredible. We had flown in around 8-9am into Chicago and we arrived into Madison around noon, so we were hungry after our travels, and I believe I speak for everyone I was with that day when I say it flat out hit the spot. Great atmosphere too, being that it is in a college town, a lot of energy and the staff was very attentive and polite. If you are in the area, it's a no brainer, this place is a gem!

I'm surprised by some of the reviews already posted, I found the food very delicious and everything had a nice twist to items that might have otherwise been boring.  Case in point-the blackberry jam served with sweet potato fries, as well as a nice herby mayo.  The onion rings were also fantastic, I recommend buying those regardless of your meal choice, and definitely with a beer! (served with a great buttermilk dressing sauce and a tangy bbq-type sauce) I had the Apple rum burger which was very good, and chose the wasabi seed green beans which were a nice alternative to potatoes (although I stole some fries from another person's plate and they were great too)  Everyone else enjoyed their meal, and I was definitely eyeing the stuffed grilled cheese and BFLT.  Good prices too for the food and great beer selection (next time i go im going to try the bloody mary, it listed it as made with freshly squeezed juices--none of that mix crap!)  http://www.alchemycafe.net/id2.html

We get to Alchemy a couple times each month, and it's become a go-to place for us. The food is solid, the service is OK, and the beer selection is terrific.  Here are our favorites: - Friday night fish fry. It's way too much food, but the fish is some of the best in Mad'town. You'll have to wait for a table, but if you time it right, it's soooo worth it. - Beer selection. Always changing, and always good. - Bloody Marys. They make their own vegetable juice...so their BMs are a little "sweeter" than others because of the carrot juice, but amazing. - Maize salad. That sucker will fill you up...with goodness - Zaremba burger. I think my GF dreams about this burger at night. That's probably why there's sometimes drool on her pillow - BLT. The aoli is out of sight, and they really toast that homemade bread. - Sweet potato fries can be a little spotty, and they're not available on Friday nights, because the fryer is too busy making your fish.  If you're going for the first time, here's a free parking tip: on evenings and weekends the parking lot PAST Alchemy (to the South/East) is always free with plenty of spaces.

This is my favorite place in Madison. Great atmosphere, good music most nights of the week. I love the farmer's lunch and daily specials. Great local food options at decent prices. Decent beer selection.   They don't take cards, so make use of the ATM inside.

This is my favorite place to eat in Madison. Every dish is well thought out, ingredients are fresh. Best dish is their flank steak, only $14, can't beat the flavor and the price. Only downside is they do not accept credit cards, but worth it to have cash on hand.

One of my favorite places to have a late lunch/early dinner - it's nice and cozy, and still quiet at that time. The sweet potato fries are fantastic, and I can never choose between the stuffed grilled cheese and the matilda.  The beer is reasonably priced, as well. Great vegetarian comfort food!

I've been here twice and had a good experience both times.  It has a nice neighborhood cafe/pub kind of ambiance.  There seems to be a wait on Friday and Saturday, but that's pretty typical.  They do have a bar area where you can have a drink.  Nice selection of beers.  I would say that overall the food is good but not amazing.  Service has been good as well.

Alchemy is easily my husband and my go-to place to eat when we can't decide. They have an excellent rotating tap selection and the food is local, delicious and cheap! Whenever possible, try the specials, especially the Batch bread plate of the day! My only complaint is that when they do Friday Fish Fry, they don't offer their amazing sweet potato fries. Also lots of great vegetarian options, which makes me very happy. I recommend the Matilda sandwich, the Maize salad, and my husband recommends the Tin Shack Smokehouse burger. The service is generally good, but sometimes leaves something to be desired. Also expect a wait if you go out after 6pm on weekends and many weekdays.

This place is ok....I mean the reviews seem a bit over the top to say the least. The Alchemy fancies itself as a rival to perhaps The Weary Traveler....it's not. The food is just average and the hippy decor is just plain annoying. They do have a small outdoor patio which helps the cause. Big beer selection so if you envision yourself knowing the ins and outs of "hand crafted, small batch" beers then you'll be able to overlook the shortcomings.
Love the comfortable interior and they always have great beer on tap.  I usually order whatever they have on special and am always please.  The soup has always been great.
Great beer lists, best onion rings in town and a menu with something for everyone that features local ingredients.
Just went there for fish with my family. DELICIOUS!!! I also love the stuffed grilled cheese. Would recommend if you're looking for a great local Madison restaurant!

consistently good food. great house burger. always creative specials. typically an excellent beer list, but recently I've noticed they've been focusing a lot on WI brews which, imo, are average on average. a seat at the bar is my favorite spot. the bartenders are usually pretty cool and fun to chat with and are good for an honest beer recommendation. nice space. no tvs. good music. expect to wait around dinner time, just grab a beer and hang out.

Let me start out by saying I am...was... the biggest, most loyal Alchemy fan.  Until tonight.  I am basically obsessed with the Tinshack burger, see, and well, I am expecting see, and I have been craving this burger a LOT.  I won't even consider going elsewhere for a burger.  Until tonight!  A few weeks ago when I started craving this I ordered a well-done burger for takeout, doctor's orders, and got home to a medium rare burger :(  (Even though I listened to my husband say it HAD to be well done, I am expecting, and so forth.)  So... I cooked it some more at home.  It was sad.  They gave me half off my next burger.  I had them cut it in half so I could be sure it was well done before I left.  I was happy.  Then tonight I ordered another one and if was medium-rare!  DH said it was even more rare when he got there and he waited while they put it back on for more time.  (What the heck?!)  We had to drive all the way across town to get a new, well-done burger, as we had ordered it!  This is a safety issue, I HAVE to have it well done, and he not only tells them that when he orders, he also, as I said, asks for it to be cut in half so he can check.  So we drove all the way back to the Alchemy, my once favorite place of all time to get a burger and they make me a new one.  It is burnt, and I mean, really burnt.  Char is not good for me or my little one.  I am not much of a cook, but I CAN make a burger well done and not burnt.  !  I am just really sad and disappointed.  I feel this place, again, my favorite place, has no pride, respect, or standards for their customer.  It just takes a little time and a little care to make a burger well done and not burnt.  What they served me in unacceptable- not once,not TWICE, but three times.  I went from biting into rare meat to eating char tonight and it does not make me happy.  I am done, and I was a HUGE fan.  The hugest.

By most measures, I should love Alchemy. The food is very nicely done pub fare and the taps are second to none. The space is cozy with hardwood floors and an elevated bar, and they often feature local music.   However, Alchemy doesn't appear to care about their customers very much. The main reason for this is that they are cash-only. To add insult to injury, they have installed a high-surcharge ATM inside the building. This tells me two things: their business practices may be unethical (I was told all their logs are "hand-written") and they care more about customers' money than their happiness. They deflect inquiries about cards by claiming that cash-only "keeps it local". No, what it actually means is that they are deliberately not leaving a tax trail. Unless you like carrying large bundles of cash around, this also makes Alchemy a poor choice for groups, which is too bad -- shouldn't they want our business? This is 2015. If you can't afford to take cards (ever hear of Square?), or an alternate payment method than cash, you can't afford to be in business.

I was excited to try out Alchemy for all the vegetarian and vegan options.  Unfortunately, due to some temporary dairy and soy allergies, (I am nursing my newborn that can't have those things come through my milk) I was unable to get what I really wanted from the menu.  This review is less about the food and more about the service.  Felicia (sp?) was the best waitress I have come across in a really long time.  I appreciated her true concern for my allergies.  Most people in the restaurant industry won't take the time to go back and double check things in the kitchen.  More often than not, when I ask questions about ingredients, they say- "I think it's fine" or "I don't think there's blah blah in there"...  Ummm, how about don't think... KNOW.  Be knowledgable about your menu, and if you can't know everything- go ask.  Please don't make me ask you to go and double check.  I didn't need to ask Felicia,  and it was so refreshing.  The chefs in the back also erred on the side of caution for me.  Thank you so much!! We'll be back when I can eat whatever I want!
Huge fan. Sweet potato fries are mind blowing! Always enjoy the staff too. The biggest downside is that it's so busy on weekends.

I know I don't speak for everyone, but for my wife and myself I can definitely say that the hamburgers we ate last night were some of the best we have ever eaten.  This was our first time in Madison, went for a concert at the Berrymore, and wanted to get something to eat before, saw this place on the web, liked the menu, and my wife was happy after we left.  I highly suggest it.

Really enjoyed Alchemy.  Went with my girlfriend and thought it was a great spot for a date but I think it would be great for groups.  We were seated right away on a Saturday night and the service was really good.  Beer selection was good, cocktails were really good, and the wings are incredible.  Loved the cheese on them and they had the right amount of heat.  Will definitely be back.

I had been to alchemy once before and the food was pretty good both times. However, my service was so poor the second time that I feel compelled to write a review.     First, please never order their Kalamata martini unless you love drinking extremely salty drinks! I asked my husband to try it just to make sure I was not off base and he totally agreed with me that it was actually undrinkable (like sea water).      I had asked my server about the martini ahead of time and got a very vague and unhelpful description. I then made the mistake of ordering it. When I tried it and politely said to the server, "I am really sorry but i am not enjoying this drink at all," I was interrupted by her and told that because it was such an expensive drink, she would have to charge me and that she could not replace the drink. I accepted this answer even though I was irritated by it.  Then I very calmly asked that in the future, if asked about the drink, she consider emphasizing the salty quality to future customers. I was met with defensiveness and attitude. I did not order another drink during the night and the whole experience did put a negative spin on the evening. I wish this place would understand that it is behaving in a way that is penny wise and pound foolish. Had they responded in a kinder way, I would have bought more drinks that evening and would have returned to the restaurant in the future but now I won't. Seems hardly worth the small cost of replacing the drink to me!

When my husband and I first arrived in Madison from Berkeley, CA, this was the first restaurant that we ate at in our new neighborhood.  I remember us both sighing with relief as we read over the menu taking in the selection of craft brews and locally sourced eats.  While our fears of not being able to satisfy our pretentious palates in Madison were generally unwarranted, to us, Alchemy remains a stand out in the exciting Madison restaurant scene.        Three factors pulled us to this restaurant when we were deciding where to eat out in the neighborhood (and when should have been making dinner at home): beer, food, and ambiance.    A big wave of excitement would fall over us as we sat down and the table and got our first look at the tap beer list, which is a carefully selected list of great (relatively local) brews that rotates very frequently.  Lots of high gravity beers here served in goblets, which inspired one of my signature phrases when we are out and about, "I want a big beer in a tiny glass!"    The food is generally very good with the stand out being the very reasonably priced and delicious hangar steak served with broccoli and mashed potatoes.  The Friday Fish Fry is one of the best in town.  The French Fries are extra delicious making it difficult to choose the healthier side option of sesame green beans although these are also really tasty (best to order both sides and share with your dining companion).  Love the desserts, a varying selection of cakes and pies, produced in house or by Honey Bee Bakery.   The dark wood in this place lends an air of romance making it a great date spot as long as the live music interests both parties.

The Tinshack and Zaremba burger are on my top 5 burgers in town. Maybe even top 3! Wasabi green beans are a must. Best Sweet potato fries in town, you just can't get them on Friday's as they have their fish fry. Always busy so expect a wait but it is worth it. Great rotating beer list and service is always pretty friendly.Free music almost every evening makes it a great destination in the Schenks Corners neighborhood

Love the beer menu-great descriptions and it changes. Food is always yummo, appears freshly made. Small place, fills up fast, we make a habit of stopping at "off peak" times. Sweet potato fries are a must try. There is a "daily special" post on Facebook about 5 pm.

Found Alchemy Cafe yesterday on Yelp! and decided to give it a try, since my husband and I are in Madison for the week.  I'm VERY glad we found it!  It looks like a small place from the outside, but it's actually fairly big inside.  It's atmosphere is that of a pub, but it's not dark and overpowering.  We were there for a late lunch so it wasn't very busy, but I can imagine this place would have an interesting mix of people in the evenings.    That being said there was one bartender/server working this shift.  He was friendly and knowledgeable about the beers.  I had the Hairy Eyeball which was a very good choice if you like Fat Tire.  The Hairy Eyeball is very flavorful and finishes nice with just a faint hint of bitter.  My husband had the something Rasputin, which is on a nitrous tap.  Talk about big, bold, and smooth!!  I had the Zaremba burger, with olive relish, gorgonzola, swiss cheese.  I think "flavorgasm" would be an appropriate description :)  The one thing that did irk me was the $3.50 upcharge to have the sweet potato fries instead of regular fries or salad.  HOWEVER, when the giant plate of sweet potato wedges were brought out instead of a regular side, all was forgiven.  Oh yea, blackberry jalapeno jam with the sweet potatoes was HEAVENLY!!  Even with that upcharge, for both of our burgers and beers the tab was $25 for two people.  That was a very pleasant surprise :)  I hope to get back to Alchemy later this week sometime, if not I will be back the next time I get to Madison.

The grilled bison burger was the best of any type burger I have tasted in Madison and beyond. The  chip-shaped French fries were also delicious and deep fried in fresh oil. The squash soup was spicy, but not overpoweringly so.  The ambiance is old and rustic- bare brick, wood floors, tables and bar.  My only quibble was the loud rockabilly which echoed almost painfully off the bare brick walls.  They were nicely obliging in turning it down to background level.  No plastic accepted.

Visited alchemy a few times before for a beer but today was my first time eating there. The beer selection is always top notch. Maybe 7 or 8 taps, which isnt a lot, but they rotate often and are always great. I had the Applerum Burger w a side salad and my girlfriend had the stuffed grilled cheese and green beans. The grilled cheese was the better of the two. We also got some sweet potato fries which added to the good meal. Overall the food is above average, but the beer selection and cool atmosphere makes up for it. They also have great music almost every night.

Don't come here expecting typical bar food - this is one of my favorite restaurants in Madison.  Creative dishes with fresh ingredients and well cooked. Good selection of beers on tap, love the neighborhood vibe.

I can't even bring myself to describe the Alchemy menu as "bar food."  Yes, it's a bar and yes, they have food...BUT the menu is so much more than burgers and fries. The Farmers Plate with portabella pate is a terrific starter as are the awesome sweet potato fries (none of those faux sweet potato fries, these are the real thing).  They menu changes often, though they always keep stalwart favorites such as the Arboretum Burger.  Definitely try the Wasabi Green Beans for a side!  One of the best things is Alchemy's commitment to local, organic.  Oh, did I mention the beer list AMAZING!  The tap beer is ever-changing and always features some of the best beer available.

I had heard great things about Alchemy so went for dinner with two friends on a Friday night. We were told the wait would be about 40 minutes but it ended up being half that which was a pleasant surprise. We ordered the tinshack smokehouse (bison) burger w/ wasabi green beans, chile marinated flank steak, and the night's special which was a whole rainbow trout. (Side note- they do not serve their sweet potato fries on Friday due to Friday Fish Fry which we found out too late). For drinks we got an Earl Grey Moscow Mule and the Hibiscus/Kombucha/Gin drink. All of the mains were really tasty but the sides were nothing special which was disappointing considering the rave reviews the wasabi green beans have gotten. We really enjoyed the burger and the fish especially. The drinks were a completely different story- the Earl Grey Moscow Mule tasted like lime water and the Kombucha cocktail tasted like lemon water. I know they're famous for their beer list but there didn't seem to be a trace of alcohol in either of our cocktails. I would definitely recommend checking out Alchemy for their main dishes but will never be getting a cocktail from there again.

Wow, what a great place.  We had the sweet potato fries and they were great and the blackberry jalapeno jam that came with it was amazing.  My hubby had the hanger steak and it was very tender and delicious.  He especially appreciated how easy it was to sub out the potatoes that came with it for a really nice salad.  Very nice side of carrots with that dish as well.  I had the daily special which was a pulled pork sandwich with ham and pickled eggs and it was so good and so big.  I had a salad with it too and really loved the beets and nuts and goat cheese in it.  I would go here again in a heartbeat.  The service was great, and they did a nice job fixing up the restaurant without losing the neat character of all the old wood in the place.  Can't wait to come back and try something else!
I had the pasta special with scallops.  It was mediocre at best.   The beer selection was great though.

I tend to overlook Alchemy sometimes, due to it's proximity to my house. That is a huge mistake because it is awesome! Last night, my sister and I sat outside (blissful) and split their specialty mac n' cheese and a salad. We are STILL raving about that mac....omg...so amazing. The salad was good, as usual. Our server was personable, knowledgeable and efficient. I generally have a good experience there with service, however the only reason I knock off one star is due to the fact that a few times, I went in there just for beers and I felt like the server was annoyed with me for not ordering food. In general, I love this place and I'm so glad it exists in the 'hood.

Foods amazing, female waitstaff are kind of seriously assholes.  I get that it's busy, but it's usually like that. If you want to keep the volume manageable by acting like that to the patrons, mission accomplished.

If you can find a better dinner in Madison for 10 bones please let me know. Alchemy is a fantastic gastro pub. Simple, flavorful food paired with an excellent ever changing beer selection. I have been many times and tried nearly everything on the menu. I have never been disappointed. The layout is a bit funky and sometimes you have to wait for 10 minutes but it is well worth it. The staff are efficient, professional beautiful people. I use this as a benchmark to other restaurants in terms of quality and price. If other restaurateurs are wondering why people are not coming or their business is not doing so well go pay Alchemy a visit and see how it is done. A+

Great food, fantastic taps, and the best sweet potato fries in town.  I probably eat lunch here more often than any other single venue.  Cash only, but there's an ATM inside.  The sweet potato fries are well-executed, and are incredible dipped in the jalapeno and blackberry jam.  I seldom eat there without ordering them, though it's best to share the platter with a friend.  (Note they reserve the fryer for fish on Friday.  No fries for you!)  If I can resist the daily special, I'll order a small maize salad.  (The large is too much with the sweet potato fries.)  The spicy garbanzo beans are a delicious way to deliver protein in a tasty vegetarian entree.  When introducing friends, I also recommend the stuffed grilled cheese (my wife's favorite), which incorporates veggies in with the cheddar and Swiss.  The toasted sourdough holds up well to the filling.  The hanger steak makes for a fantastic dinner.  The wine reduction with rosemary complements the beef well, the gorgonzola providing sharp contrast.

I am a HUGE fan of Alchemy!  However, you need to be aware that there are some quirks before you go, and I can only speak for the vegetarian options.  Cons:  - Like other reviewers mention, the temperature is not well controlled.  Every time the door opens, a cold blast sweeps in.  Try to sit away from the door or in the windows.  - The atmosphere is definitely bar style.  I love the low-key feel, but it is not a place to go on an anniversary or a business lunch.    - Parking can be a bit tricky on the weekends.  Generally, it isn't a problem.  - They only take cash.  - The service is hipster-ish and occasionally disinterested.  However, it has never been rude or poor.  Pros:  - The food is inventive and outstanding.  I don't care for green beans or wasabi, but the wasabi green beans are unbe-freakin'-livable.  The fried green tomato sandwich was a fantastic culinary romp.  My dining companion loves their chickpea salad - which is very good.   - The location is great for hanging out in the Willy Street/Atwood area.  There are great bars around it for after dinner drinks.  Overall, go with the right mindset and you won't regret it!

Their sweet potato fries and the jalapeno jam... to die for. In all honesty, the sweet potato fries themselves were not that great. But the combination of the two is AWESOME. They are cash only, so come prepared! But if you're not, they have an ATM next to the bar.

Had a really great experience here earlier today. The place was jammed but I found a solo spot at the bar. The girl behind the bar served me a water without me asking and a menu. She told me right off the bat that they were running low on some menu items because they were closing for a few days the next day and they were running down the inventory to avoid spoilage and loss. I appreciate being told that right away before I try to order some thing(s) and then being told that they're out. Anyway, I scored the last Tinshack Smokehouse Burger which was a perfectly cooked medium rare bison burger with all the fixins. Complemented perfectly with a tap of Founders Dissenter...a beer I had been wanting to try! Thanks for being open on Labor Day and thank you for the terrific meal and outstanding service!
Get the stuffed grilled cheese. Don't even look at anything else. Just get it. One of the best things you'll taste in this city.

So have wanted to try The  Alchemy for a while. Tonite, by chance, we found our way there.  We were early, but were welcomed in by, we assume, the Owner/Manager.  Cocktails were excellent. The bartender was busy, but friendly. And the food...OMG...I tried the special, pan fried Walleye with wild rice with Cherries and Almonds plus grilled asparagus.  What can I say? Excellent blend of flavors and textures.  The Mrs, had the fish fry - cod - with house fries and slaw. Huge portion, well prepared, full of flavor.  The menu here has lots of options that we want to try. We will be back.

Delicious Friday Fish Fry. The French fries are unique and super fresh. The tartar sauce is wonderful and the fish was splendid. Their cherry brandy in the brandy old fashioned is a must do. Have to pay with cash, but that's fine.
Service was great. I loved my Wild Rose drink with kombucha. Food was great. The fish tacos had marinated cucumber which tasted funky, so won't order them again. But the flank stake was delicious.

it says on the menu, cash/check only. yeah no sign on the door, but should there be? had the burger and sat at the bar and drank some fantastic beer on tap. good service on a busy friday nite from tenders. burger was top notch, person next to me had the friday nite special fish fry, heaping plate and he said it was excellent. excellent atmosphere, excellent food and pretty good service on a busy nite.

love it!  My only complaint is that it's a long wait, but part of the reason for that is that it's a small place, which also adds to the charm and character of The Alchemy.  They know how to cook some great food--lots of flavor.  The one thing I didn't like was the fish tacos.

This is one of my favorite places to frequent in Madison.  Everything on the menu is great.  I would recommend the stuffed grilled cheese and the sweet potato fries all with local food.   They also have a great craft beer tap list and the bloody mary is fantastic.  The mix is homemade with a jack lalane juicer.  The only downfall is that it is cash only, but also have an ATM onsite.

The food is phenomenal!  So many vegetarian/vegan dishes.  The stuffed grilled cheese is delicious as is the Bison burger.  The tables are apart from bar but you still get the feeling of being in a casual spot.  Service was great!  Highly recommend this place.
Great food, creative spin with local ingredients. Best burger I've had in awhile. Friendly staff. Will be returning soon.

I like this place. The dining area is incredibly cavernous given that the place just looks like a little storefront bar from outside. The elevated seating areas set the customers slightly apart from the main room and have great views of the busy streets outside. They have a fantastic tap beer selection, and the food was fine. The beer-battered BLT was a fun concept, and my friend thought the buffalo burger was good. I will be back to try more.

What a fabulous place on Atwood! Nice, casual ambiance and fantastic food!  It's seat yourself and the day we came, there was only one waitperson for the whole place. She was a wonder to watch! Friendly and courteous to each and every guest, timing her appearances at the tables perfectly and never once letting on that she was run off her feet! It helped that the kitchen cranked out wonderful food at a good pace. I got the stuffed grilled cheese sandwich which was utterly delicious! It came with a seasonal salad which had lovely beets and fried parsnips. It was to die for! The table got an order of the renown sweet potato fries which come with a couple of dipping sauces you want to take a bath in.  And the prices are entirely reasonable, a bargain actually when you consider the caliber of the food. We will be back next time we're in Madison!

I went here on the way through town on the recommendation of a friend.  However, I left quite disappointed.  The service was as poor as I've had in years.  It took quite a long time to get menus and place our order, but it wasn't exceptionally bad.  However, it then took somewhere on the order of an hour to receive our food.  I had planned to stop in for a quick sandwich and get back on the road, and instead I found that our meal took over an hour and a half.  I understand that maybe sometimes a kitchen gets backed up or somebody doesn't show up for the day, but the waitress never communicated with us that there were any problems.  if she had done so, or given me a chance to order something quicker, that would have made my experience much more pleasant.  Perhaps that would have been acceptable if the food were exceptional, but it really wasn't.  I ordered the Walleye Po'Boy, and while it was certainly tasty, it left a fair bit to be desired.  The baguette was, quite simply, a pretty crappy baguette, and that really did a lot to bring down the sandwich.  It was simply too thick, having nothing of the airy interior and crunchy exterior of a good baguette.  I thought the walleye was great, but the jalapeno remoulade left me wondering where the jalapeno was.  All in all, I could have probably left somewhat bordering on happy if it hadn't taken so long to get the sandwich.  I will say, however, that the beer selection was great and reasonably priced, and the service on my beer was perfectly fine.

No CREDIT CARD!! ONLY CASH! Also they dont want to give receipt because they dont have enough receipt!!!! If u ask they will write a new one give u that!  Food was good, environment was noy that cool, more like old place!

Great food. It "feels" nice in there. A place where you can go with your mom for lunch and go out for birthday drinks with friends that night. It gets kind of uncomfortably busy sometimes. But I enjoy the sweet potato fries and their specials are always realllly tasty too.
Sweet potato fries w/ jam = BEST SIDE DISH EVER
Not in Madison often and just took a stab at a new place. Good beer & good food before theater at the Barrymore.  Had a cram cake appetizers, Veggie Curry and Perch Tacos. Delish!

We went here for the burgers and based on the reviews, the burgers were supposed to be really good but we were very disappointed. The burgers were very dry and tasteless.   The salad was equally unimpressive despite the description that included beets, blue cheese and unique dressing.  The best part was the cheesecake which they source from the Looking Glass Bakery. Absolutely phenomenal.

Great food--good choice of beers. Neat atmosphere. All and all a place you really should stop by if you are in Madison and you are interested in checking out a cool place with great food and good beer. The only downside is that they take cash only (but do have an ATM inside). The other downside is that it can fill up pretty quick inside and also get a bit loud....but then again--consider your location!

Came in a little after 5 and was seated right away. Sweet potato fries were good and the dipping sauces were interesting, but I think they're best plain. I ordered an Applerum burger. Toppings were really good, not as much meat to bun as I prefer and I felt my medium was more of a medium well. Potato salad was really bland, wouldn't get it again. Tried a bite of the Grilled cheese; was not what Id usually order but was really good for what it was. The meal I ordered was more of a three stars but I feel like there are some really good menu items and I liked the ambiance of the place.
LOVED the decor, atmosphere and food. It was a bit noisy, but that's a fair trade-off for an uncrowded, friendly local joint with superb cooking. I'll certainly be back.

Well now, moving up in the world a bit perhaps, are we? The last two meals there have been pretty stellar and satisfying. It's a rare occurrence in these parts. Service is service, but my expectations aren't too high.

3.8  Alchemy is one of those places that feels good, and so you return, even though some experiences here are better than others.   Alchemy's Bloody may rival Sardine as the best one in town (see photo). They make their own habanero tequila for the Bloody Maria, which is v. spicy and delicious, and they serve it with cheese, sausage, and the usual WI accoutrements, including a beer back.  The beer is great.   Service tends to be better at the bar. This is one of those places that never seems to catch up with its volume, so service can be slow and spotty when the restaurant is overloaded.  The food quality is up and down. The fish sandwiches are usually awesome, as are the sweet potato fries. You must try Alchemy's very own hot sauce and jalapeno jam. Many of the other dishes waver in quality. Their salads are made of uninspiring spring lettuce mix that comes out of a bag--yuck! I think you can often judge a restaurant by its dressings, and the salad dressings, though homemade, need help (as do the salads themselves).   Liz Chapa is a dessert goddess and you can get her desserts here.   Cash only.  Update: Someone from the restaurant wrote me to say, in so many words, that every restaurant in Madison gets their greens out of the bag in winter because greens are hard to procure freshly (and to grow). My point in this case is NOT that the greens come out of a bag; I'm not naive about food & I do understand that greens cannot be grown by restaurants or food distributors in hothouses all winter. My point is that Alchemy's greens are uninspired and look like the spring mix that you can buy at any grocery store. Choose a better mix of greens is my take-home message, if greens are to be on the menu. Sardine is a great example of a Madison restaurant that has found a way to serve inspired salads using ordinary greens. I do appreciate, however, that someone from Alchemy felt compelled to write.

Have been to alchemy many times, and I love it each time. Always a great selection of beers, and the staff is knowledgeable about them. The addition of a strawberry chipotle glaze to the baby back ribs this last time I went was truly awesome. They're also very vegetarian and vegan friendly. Aside for the food and beer, I love the vibe of the place. All are having fun and it was fine for our month-old baby in there

Oh. My. God.   So, the burgers are delicious, great beers on tap, great warm, old-school wood-paneled atmosphere... Yes, and yes. But the impetus behind this five-star review was the chicken tzatziki taco special on December 19. Please, please make these a regular menu item! Ah. Maze. Ing. Especially with a hopquila margarita! So good!!! If you haven't been here, go!

Much love for Alchemy, our neighborhood standby. All of the food is delicious and unique.  I love their hanger steak and all of the salads. The fish fry is as delectable as everyone says (in my opinion, top in town). My boyfriend and I usually split an order of their AMAZING wings- crazy good cocoa/buffalo/barbecue sauce on those- as well as as the Tinshack burger which is a bison burger with bacon and smoked onions and Muenster cheese... my mouth is watering just thinking of it.  Alchemy defaults to splitting the burger and its accompanying side (usually we get the fries, which are more American fry than French fry, but tasty nonetheless) in the kitchen so it's perfectly portioned when it gets to the table- it's the little things like this that elevate Alchemy from great to fantastic.  Other little things: prices reasonable, portions perfect.  Ingredients are fresh and local and that makes a huge taste difference. Plus the beer list varies wonderfully and frequently- as does the dessert list; we've loved every dessert we've tried, but do not miss their cheesecakes!!!   Minus one star from perfect for two reasons- one, service can be inattentive/not the friendliest, we always hope to get one of our two favorite servers who are gracious and totally on it but when we don't we end up waiting 15-20 minutes for things like the check or refills. Also because some nights we go there and the live music is just overpowering the space.  I'm a total fan of live music but Alchemy is really tiny, and it seems the sound could easily be tweaked on nights with a band so that diners and musicians could coexist. Instead, we end up yelling over music that's supposedly mellow background music (jazz ensembles, bluegrass etc)... then everyone in the place is yelling, and it gets uncomfortably loud.  Regardless, we're regulars, and it's our favorite place to be on the East side.

We stopped in here on a whim one Friday night with a small group. The food was ok. I like the mashed potatoes and someone in our party had the grilled cheese. Everything would have been perfect if the band hadn't started playing so loud. It was an empty house, so it would have been nice to socialize at our table with friends and talk. Instead we were yelling over the table at eachother and couldn't really catch up. I could understand if the place had a lot of people, but it was pretty empty.

We were treated by our friends who live in the area. They recommended this place after we decided on getting some burgers.  I ordered the Delux burger with habenero aioli, red onions, lettuce, tomatoes, and pickles. It came with a side, which were fries, orzo salad, potato salad, or a side salad. I went with the couscous. I thought the choice of sides were a welcoming touch, not many places offers sides beyond the standard variation of a potato.  The first remarkable thing about the burger was the crunchy pickles! Yes, I noticed the pickles first because they were unlike any other ordinary pickles I've encountered. The cucumber was not quite as 'fresh' as the Dotty Dumpling Dowry ones, a little sweeter and crunchier. The burger was very juicy, I believe they said the beef is grass fed. It folded nicely between the toffy-colored buns and singed with the aioli. The orzo salad was good, lightly dressed in a balsamic vinaigrette with small chunks of onions and red peppers. It was a bit bland, I think I'll try another one of their many interesting sides next time.  There was a healthy tap beer list of 10 rotating beers, which is surprising for a smaller place like this.  There was a stage near the bay windows for live music on the weekends. I can't wait to come back and try the fish fry and catch a show!

Their stuffed grilled cheese is awesome. The side of fries are definitely interesting but not consistent. One time it was crunchy, and the other time it was just drenched in oil and felt undercooked. Overall this place is awesome mainly because of the stuff grilled cheese sandwich.
Love this place! Well done-I always get the sweet potato fries which are amazing! Burgers are great too. Haven't had a thing I didn't like there yet.
I'm always a bit annoyed by the hassle of a cash only restaurant. Alchemy is worth the hassle.  Delicious food with fresh takes on old classics.  This one is a keeper.

Everything about this place is good. Best old fashioned in Madison. Best decor. Best burgers. Best everything! The food is so reliably good and they always have unique options to choose from. Once I got a sweet potato/blackberry pate and it was amazing. Another time I just stuck to the curry and it was also amazing. This is my go-to place in Madison hands down!

I don't understand what the fuss or "cool factor" about this place. The food is pretty mediocre (lots of burgers and sandwiches and salads kind of place). Not any kind of impressive drink selection because the typical options you would see at a sit-down restaurant in Madison. It's located in an area that's difficult to get to (little parking and in the middle of a weird traffic triangle). Once inside, it's pretty much a "meh" feeling looking around.

I feel right at home when the first thing asked of me upon sitting down at a table is, "Bloody Mary's?" On a Sunday morning recovery lunch excursion, our server didn't have to ask us twice. Their Bloodies have the perfect amount of spice and flavor - definitely a fan.  For food, I opted most recently for the BLFT, which OMFG, why have I not been requesting my tomatoes to be fried in a beer batter for every sandwich I've ever eaten? I went with a cous cous salad with pumpkin and walnuts for my side since it was the special for the day. It's all about balance, my friends. My companion hammered through the Tinshack Smokehouse Burger with fries and after taking a bite of the burger, I almost went hobbit on that lunch and devoured both our meals. I think I'm still finding green peppercorn aioli under my nails. Yum. Ew.  Warm ambiance and a casual setting with anything but casual food. The only downside is they only take cash but the fee for the ATM isn't too lucrative. Get at it.

Bloody Mary was NOT good. Bison burger was amazing! Asked for no bun but got one. Not a huge deal but it's the attention to detail. They have KOMBUCHA! Every thing is local and grass fed! Love! Just don't get the Bloody Mary!

Had no idea what to expect was parked close by and walked in shortly after it opened. Greeted by a very energetic waitress which started off my experience on the right foot. First impression loved the set up of tables and bars it has  different areas some elevated a bit, others right in front of Windows very cool for people watching. Had an old fashioneded with a slightly different take mixed with ginger beer  very refreshing. Than ordered wings and since im world reknowed  as a wing expert was excited.  presentation was perfect and they did not disappoint. 7 out of 10. Will be back!

The atmosphere was cool, my burger was basic... The fries were great and so were the Bloodys! The BBQ and ranch was also amazing. Service was kinda iffy though, we were enjoying our drinks after our meal and just relaxing and our server asked if we wanted our bill because she was done with her shift soon. It was kind of awkward and made us feel like we were over staying our welcome.
Great food, amazing service and tasty cocktails. There daily specials are always yummy. Almost always my first choice of places to go

Today was my first time ever visiting this restaurant, and we came in around 4, right in the middle of happy hour. There is an excellent selection of beers and mixed drinks, so I had a sour beer--something that included passion in its name but I can't remember all that well.  Our server was friendly and attentive and our food came out quickly. I had the perch tacos, which had a nice amount of acidity and it was a good portion size. The fish was well-cooked and fresh tasting, so no complaints here. I tried the house boat as well, which was surprisingly moist and tasty (considering that chicken breast tends err on the side of dry).  From start to finish, this was an enjoyable dining experience that I would recommend!

I was initially very excited to go to Alchemy because it is close to a lot of great bars and restaurants, so I figured it would be among some of my favorite spots. Their service is fine, nothing special, their food is mediocre, and their beer/cocktail menu is limited. They are also cash only, so make sure you get cash in advance. They do have an ATM in cash of a pinch.
Had a great cocktail here called the "philosophers stone".    The French fries were out of this world.

Loved it! All the food our table ordered was great. I had the flank steak and it was not only amazing tasting, but was a great deal. They only take cash so be prepared, otherwise there's an ATM with $1 surcharge. The dessert was SO GOOD! We had a blueberry cheesecake that was to die for!

Alchemy has an excellent beer selection and a fantastically inventive food menu. I appreciate locally sourced everything, and it's all good. These are the best burgers in Madison, and I highly recommend going Deluxe on your burger - the aioli adds a satisfying, sloppy heat.  It's on the expensive side for Madison, but it is worth it.  Minus one star for a disappointing fish fry.

Alchemy was a hit among my roommates and I! We don't live near the Atwood area, but based on the crowds it seems like a neighborhood favorite.   The food definitely matched the bustling atmosphere. I was really a surprised to see the balance between vegan dishes and meat. This is rarity in the Madison restaurant world. We chose this spot based on recommendations from friends that it's gluten friendly, but we were disappointed to find out that they don't offer gluten free bread. My roommates' pulled pork sandwich slightly lacked, because she wasn't able to eat the bread.   That being said, my Zaremba burger (grass fed) was so juicy and delicious. The green peppercorn aioli paired well but was not overpowering.   Overall, I will definitely be going back to alchemy to enjoy good drinks and good vibes in the Atwood neighborhood.
Delicious food, love the $6 tasty cocktails! Always a fun place to take visitors and friends.

I went to Alchemy after a family wedding. I was impressed. If I still lived in Madison, it would certainly be on of my regular haunts.  A live bluegrass band was playing, so the atmosphere was upbeat. We had a large group and the staff was able to put together tables for us.   The beer list was great. The food was even better. I love it when a neighborhood bar takes the effort to elevate their food. We had a wide assortment of appetizers to share, and everything was much better than your average bar fare.
Great burgers! Great (hand-cut) chips! Nice tap beer selection. I'm a fan.

The flank steak was amazing. Perfectly done, tons of flavor. Location and ambiance cozy and interesting. Hostess friendly, server not but even that didn't ruin our visit. Must have the old fashioned. Highly recommend.

First of all, FYI, they only accept cash or check. However, they have an ATM located in the restaurant that only charges $1 fee.   Secondly, the food was great. I had the ultimate grilled cheese, which came highly recommended. I had higher expectations of the sandwich than what I received, but it was still very good. Each half of the sandwich, had raw onions, broccoli and so much tomatoe melted into the cheese. I had a side salad that was the highlight of my dinner. Walnuts, beets, fancy cheese all mixed with spring salad and a lightly creamy dressing. I would like to order a full size of that salad. My boyfriend had the flank steak with mashed potatoes and the seasonal vegetables (Brussel sprouts), thumbs up, all around on that dinner. We shared a side of the Wasabi green beans, that also came to me recommended. I thought they tasted like very fresh green beans. Only a few bites to me, cleared my nose, like wasabi. I totally will come back to Alchemy, easily! For those with a sweet tooth out there, I also recommend the Winter Old Fashioned and their Brandy Old Fashioned Cheesecake!
Best service ever! We sat at the same table for 5 hours (ate dinner and watched live music) and received our order of water within two minutes! Nice cozy atmosphere and yummy meals too!

I was pretty darn pleased I actually had my checkbook in my purse today, for the first time since about 2003.  Conicidence?  I think it was more like destiny!    This was a very down-to-earthy, cozy place (that is cash/check only, be prepared).  While I imagine it can be bustling on a Friday or Saturday night, we lucked out on a lazy Sunday afternoon and were able to park at a table, playing a game and sipping beers for a couple hours.  I really liked the layout of the place, lots of warm woodwork and tables on varying levels making it feel like you're tucked off in your own world.  The menu was creative and everything we had was delicious.  I had multiple vegetarian options to choose from and settled on the Matilda sandwich.  The veggies were roasted / grilled perfectly and the dressing was flavorful.  I had the seasonal salad which was also great (although next time I'd request the salad dressing on the side b/c while quite good, it was a little heavy for my taste)   The beer list was diverse and affordable, which probably explains why we stayed so long.  Although our charming yet unobtrusive waitress helped as well.  It felt like a neighborhood place with a more thoughtful menu than you'd expect (and I mean that as a complement!).  This is definitely a place I would go out of my way to visit again!

Great beer selection. About 8 taps, all of which are solid.   Nice low-key atmosphere.  Food is reasonably priced. Sandwiches and entrees between $6-12. Brutus salad is interesting, but overdressed. Mahi-mahi was flavorless but fishy. Fried tomato sandwich without much inspiration, but they weren't cheap on the bacon.

The cheap and good burger bar place.   Gem of the Atwood area. AWESOMO.   I love the beef thingies like burger, steak sandwich etc etc, chicken thingy was good and fish thingy was good. Lol, I'm terrible at names, but hey they change the menu often enough.   Get the sweet potato fries here, awesome dips and HOW do they make it so tasty!?!?! Just a note, the normal fries give the same goodness but are made of normal potatoes. The wasabi peas, ooooohhhhhh good. Seriously, not very spicy but full of flavor. And my newbie today, quinoa salad, WOOOHOOOOO.  My dish tonight was FANTASTIC. I've never had a better steak anywhere. I had the daily special honey and bourbon steak sandwich. Flavors were bursting in my mouth, the steak was so nice and chewy, and it has the cream cheese I love, reminding me of Bob's bad breath. mmmmm mmm mmmmmm. I usually have only half a burger, but I'm proud to say I FINISHED IT ALLLLLL.  Other favorites of mine are stuffed grilled cheese and the regular menu burgers, all done really well!  My man had the pineapple BBQ ribs, the flavor was top notch, but the ribs wasn't fat enough, so it wasn't soft and chewy..  Bring some cash, come on by (if you forget, there's an ATM). Might be crowded, even on weekdays, but its worth the wait!!!

I usually think the Yelp consensus on places is correct, but it was totally wrong here. I had the Applerum Burger Deluxe, and they forgot to put red onions on it. The habenero aioli was also oppressive and clouded out the flavors from the rest of the burger. Worst part, though, was that the medium basically felt like well-done, and there was no juice left. You get medium to avoid blood all over the place but to avoid eating rubber like well-done. Good test of a good burger joint is if they can pull off a medium while retaining some juices. Didn't happen here.  Also: no credit cards, even though it's 2015 and there's virtually no overhead cost to having equipment.

Great good with a great old school decor feeling.  The food is great, staff is friendly, and beer selection is awesome.  The only draw back for some is they only accept cash...not a big deal..Just plan ahead our use the cash machine on-site.

This is by far one of the greatest places to dine in Madison. Although very small, it is worth the wait. The menu isn't very big, but everything they offer is worth trying. I personally like eating dinner here, not so much lunch. The one issue here that always drives me absolutely NUTS is the ATM machine (cash only establishment). Dude, INVEST IN A NEW MACHINE! I have been coming here for years and there is always some handcrafted sign on it that explains why THAT night it isn't working for some arbitrary reason. My favorite is the sign that says it "works sometimes." I would think that this establishment would make a pretty penny, due to it being so damn delicious and neighborly, but for the love of Pete, make an investment. I think its just super irresponsible and annoying.. Other than that one thing they clearly have no interest in fixing, support this local place because it is totally worth it.   *Cash only, don't forget.

ok- the CASH ONLY policy was a bit of a shock, especially since I indulged quite a bit before closing my tab.  They do have an ATM, but it's rather odd that they don't accept credit cards.     That aside, the food and drink selection was great.  I had the flank steak with the chips, which were some of the best 'homemade fries' I have had.   It was a good portion and tasted great.    I also had too Ana Palmers, which are a must in my mind, and I don't really care for mixed drinks.  I only decided to try it after sitting at the bar and watching them make them over and over and over.  Obviously, people are ordering them for a reason.   The alcohol is a bit hidden, but on a hot day or the start to a night, they're a good fix.   I will definitely be back.      It's a great bar with great food.
The food i had was very well prepared. The negative I have is actual menu itself. The offerings seem limited and not as healthy / veggie friendly.

I have been to Alchemy twice recently. Last night I shared the Beef Brisket and the the Daily Seasonal Salad with my partner. The sandwich was absolutely yummy. The meat was cooked in a beer concoction and it was tender and incredibly flavorful. The meat was nicely shredded and the sandwich didn't fall apart when you bit into the bun. The salad was less successful. The wimpy greens just couldn't stand up to the strawberries and Gorgonzola. The greens became mushy a word that should only be used to describe your lover's Valentine card.   We finished off the meal with a delicate Tres Leches cake. It was the epitome of restraint and delicately delicious. Recently we went to Alchemy in the evening just to have dessert. We had an amazing tort and were treated to the sounds of the Oak St Ramblers. How cool to walk for a few minutes, eat a homemade treat and revel of the sound of a truly east side institution. I love my neighborhood!

You know when you are hosting someone from out of town who is just a little bit better at being a cool hipster than you?  Take them here. You'll look so good at food!  This place is just like your friend - effortlessly cool or at least really cool in a way that appears effortless. It's laid back looking and feeling, but the beard-per-capita game is very strong.  The food is totally good and the beer selection is pretty average for Madison (read: better than most other places).

Awesome food, always. Just a heads up- if you want Friday fish fry go early, the sell out & they do not serve there sweet potato fries Fri nights (they're awesome). Also get their old fashioned-it's amazing.

I had a situation a while back where I had a build-up finances and I just got fed up with waking up late and making myself hot cereal for my first meal of the day. I resolved myself to run out and find something worth treating myself to and scarfing down for the day's meal (think it was a sunny winter Saturday after 11a.) in a quiet place to unwind from the idiots I was living with at the time.   I ended up running to the Co-op and found nothing I wanted. Then after quite a jog, I wanted to see what Monty's Blue Plate was about, but they seem to have a perpetual line going out the door (man, are they really that good?). So, by now, my blood sugar is taking a dive. I went into Green Owl and wrinkled my nose. Any other time, yes, but I wanted something thick and hearty.  Seeing this place I had doubts. I didn't like the name, and I was afraid it would be deep-fried "bar food". I got the weirdest apprehensive vibe from the waitress, but I just studied the menu for a long time. I felt odd paying that much for the Bella Burger (which was cheaper, I think, back in 2012), but I now find the places back in Corktown are way through the roof on prices catering to well-off white hipsters slumming it in Detroit.   When I got it, I was surprised. It tasted good and was filling (along with all the little things that came with it). So, that impressed me. Yeah, good food for that price, definitely.  Can't say too much for the atmosphere. Yeah, it was warm and earthy, which I like,  but a bit forced on the "pub effect". The staff there seemed a bit to subdued and wrapped up in their own reserved huddles. Personally, I don't see how folks try to compare it to Weary Traveler. I remember the music kind of sucking there, but this was after 12p., so, who could expect much?   I often wondered if I'd go back and have a night session of drinks there if I re-visit there and am with the right crowd. Can't guarantee if the prices for drinks won't hurt me.  Oh, by the way, beware of the ATM they got situated right smack center of the place (which does look like a sore cybernetic thumb sticking out in this wood grain ambiance). It is from a company in an area that will gouge you silly for fees if you have a debit card.

The perfect spot for late night, quality food. Others have said it - elevated pub fare, great selection of beer/cocktails, and a cozy neighborhood bar atmosphere.  What blew me out of the water was the grilled cheese (the fries were exceptional as well). The waitress recommended adding bacon so of course I did that. I will tell you, since eating more paleo I rarely eat sandwiches, and mostly tear off as much bread as I can. This was one of the best grilled cheese sandwiches I've ever had and I would not be afraid to order this as my "cheat meal" every Saturday night. So. Damn. Good.

Been here twice, and so far...my favorite restaurant in Madison.  First time I went we went on a weekend night and it was extremely busy, with a long wait...but worth it. Sat up at the bar while we waited and kinda took in the atmosphere then. It is a pretty dark lit place, but I think it makes it more intimate. The crowd really ranges from children to elders...they bring in everyone. This visit I got one of their burgers and a bottled hard cider.   The second time went in for lunch during the week, it was tremendously less busy than on a weekend night. We ordered the sweet potato appetizer with the jalapeño jam I believe it was. I ordered the BLT and a tallboy PBR and my cousin ordered the stuffed grilled cheese, we gave each other one half of the sandwiches so we could try both! They were fantastic!  Both times service and staff are great!  Always a go to when I'm in town! :)
Soup and salad were good, but the sourdough bread was prize winning. How often do you hear that? Not often.

7/20/13 My wife and I biked to the Alchemy and enjoyed one of their awesome burgers.  They had Ale Asylum's Triple Nova on tap which we couldn't resist!  We also enjoyed a Rogue's gin & tonic.  We took the lemon and blueberry topped cheese cake to go.  It was really good.

I can't begin to tell you how much I love the alchemy's wings and sweet potato fries.  Thw fries come with a taragon aoli and... wait for it... a jalepeno jam.  They would have 6 stars in my book.... except, they only take cash.

BE SURE TO BRING CASH! I really like eating here, but the lighting is a little too dark though and it's hard to identify the staff. It's a good dating atmosphere, has a bit of a hipster/earthy vibe, and lots of good vegetarian or vegan options that aren't bland. The aioli sauces are amazing I've had people that don't like mayo not know what it was and enjoy it thoroughly. Their fries really satisfy the craving and their burgers are decent. I often order the perch tacos which are also amazing. With all the places that offer fish fry around here you think fish tacos be easier to find but this is one of the places that tops the cake of the few that serve them. My only complaints are the lighting the size of the venue ( which can't be really helped) and the staff not having any semblance of uniform even name tags or something like that would really help since it is often cramped. Really that's all I can find wrong with this venue. Definitely try to get a little earlier in the day when they have their amazing desserts from local bakeries. Actually I do have one more complaint their cocktails are the worst I've had in town, order a beer or a simple drink don't ask for any  of their specialty cocktails or anything fancy; the cocktails come in those tiny whiskey glasses stuffed over the top with ice which isn't enough for a good mixed drink to have flavor.

While it can sometimes be a little bit of a wait on a weekend, the wait staff is quick and the food is worth it. The fries are amazing (try the sweet potato ones with jalepeno jelly and garlic aioli on the side!) and the drinks are great, too. Super-helpful management. They have live music, poetry readings, and all sorts of stuff going on throughout the week. Superior beer selection for a place I don't think of primarily as a bar, and I've always had great help from the waiters choosing a beer to go with my meal. Cash/check only, but they do have an ATM on the premises!

My first time to the Alchemy, I asked for a burger without bacon or pork - the waitress informed me they don't have beef burgers without pork because they mix the two meats together. While some enjoy this flavor, this recipe piece isn't mentioned anywhere on the menu, or the website, so eat at your own risk. The fries and service were amazing though! :-)

Alchemy has easily become one of my favorite restaurants in Madison. There are so many delicious choices on the menu, but my all-time favorite is the bison burger. It has bacon and cheddar and some sort of aioli. The seasonal salads are always amazing, and the sweet potato fries with blueberry jalapeno jam are fantastic. Those aren't on the menu right now, but you *can* order ribs with that jam/sauce on it. Their cocktails are good and draught beers are solid. Even if you go early, there *will* be a crowd, so be prepared to grab a drink or chill for a bit before you're seated. It's a small place with huge popularity, but absolutely worth it. Cash only, but ATM inside :)

So effing good. I've been here a handful of times for various reasons. Once it was along my bike ride and I stopped for some drinks, another time for dinner, and again for a late snack.  Their drink specials are great. I've been lucky to enjoy two different Mule specials and haven't been let down yet.  My most favorite dish is the portobello sandwich. Sometimes these sandwiches can be too wet or mushy or very one note. This is probably the best sandwich I've ever had. I don't think I set it down once after my first bite, I inhaled it, and contemplated getting a second one. The sammy was fresh, flavorful, juicy, and texturally appealing. I absolutely loved everything about it.  The alchemy fries are a must. I don't know what they put on them but it's a delicious blend of seasoning.  If you get there before the dinner rush, you have a chance to see all their food specials before they run out. There's usually a soup, sandwich, appetizer and a few desserts.  Super chill atmosphere that's warm and inviting.

We have eaten here at least 5 times and have always enjoyed ourselves.  Going by reviews we decided to try the Friday Fish Fry.  Very disappointing.  The batter was more like the batter you find on a funnel cake at the fair.  It was puffy and not at all adhered to the fish which was practically nonexistent.  Had a salad it was okay, but not up to what I have had in the past.  Not sure if it was just because it was a busy Friday night or if there is a staff change in the kitchen.

Best restaurant of all time. Bring lots of cash and spend it all on the delicious beer, the mouth-watering food, and tip your server at least 20%, because they are all FANTASTIC! I love their cheesecakes too!

Having just moved to Madison from L.A., I am seeking cool spots with vegan options. Alchemy had been recommended to me a number of times so a friend and I checked it out on a recent Tuesday. The atmosphere was great and the host and waiter were both friendly and helpful. I loved the layout of the elevated seating levels. It was packed for a Tuesday probably because of the holiday just a few days away.   The spirit menu had some fun options and the gin/ginger beer cocktail I had was delicious and well mixed. As for the fare, it looked like the menu had one salad, one entree, maybe a soup, and four sides for me to choose from. Okay, not outstanding at first. But then I saw that I could substitute any burger with a tofu walnut burger for a vegan version of any of the three burgers. That made me very excited. The waiter assured me that the cook would prepare a delicious applerum burger vegan-style. I opted for housemade Alchemy fries and asked for a side of pickles too. When the food arrived, my friend's regular applerum burger was dripping with scrumptious toppings. Mine on the other hand looked less than appetizing, just a tofu walnut burger on toasted bread (I think sourdough), lettuce and tomato. The cheese, aioli and "sweet onion rum relish" had to removed with apparently nothing else interesting to possibly replace them. (The relish contains anchovies apparently.) The walnut burger was one of the better substitute burgers I've had in Madison, BUT there were walnut shells IN the burger...oops! Almost cracked a tooth on those, Alchemy.   The fries were outstanding! I couldn't get enough. And though I had to ask twice for the pickles, they were worth the wait. Made to perfection in-house, they were equally delightful on their own or on my sandwich.  Overall, I don't fault Alchemy for having trouble coming up with interesting things to do with vegan renditions, hence the 4 stars for great atmosphere, yummy drinks, dope fries and pickles, and professional staff. However, it was a disappointment to have zero condiments offered to me for my burger. There must be something in that kitchen to spice it up.   I'll definitely be back. Maybe the curry will be a vegan winner. Otherwise, I'll just eat before I get there.

I do not hesitate to declare Alchemy the best Friday Fish Fry in Madison. I've tried Toby's ... I've had Dexter's ... and Alchemy is my favorite, hands down. You get 4 good size pieces of cod, with a golden, fluffy breading. It comes with green beans or fries, coleslaw and a roll, for about $12.50. Oh and I almost forgot their make their own gourmet tartar sauce here too -- it doesn't come straight from a jar. If fried fish was healthier, I'd eat here every Friday.  I just realized I recently reviewed Alchemy, but after having their fish last week and visiting other restaurants that were supposedly the "best" in Madison, I felt I had to come back and review their fish again.
Had blft!  Two die for!  I come here for fries, but everything I have had is AWESOME.   the green beans are awesome.   Thanks to everyone here for another delicious experience

I love this place! My fiance and I stumbled upon this place by accident when he first moved here to work. We were looking for a place to eat, and we wandered into Alchemy. The food was fantastic. As a pescetarian, we were worried that there wouldn't be many options for me, but I've loved their vegetarian fare. We can come in here and both chow down on hearty fare. No browsing the menu for a long period of time, and finally settling on a lackluster salad here! We also enjoyed the selection of beers on tap they have.

Really, it's a 2.5 but I rounded up.  It's fine, but it's upscale bar food and the hype really raised my expectations.  I have to start with the no credit card thing - I typically avoid those places like the plague - it's the cost of doing business, you should absorb the cost rather than passing on the hassle to your customers.  But, the place is jammed so clearly enough people don't mind.  I was told the beer selection was the best in town - um, no it's not.  It's fine, a really nice selection, but it's not the best in town by far.  I had the Houseboat, chicken sandwich brined and blackened with a habanero basil mayo, really nice.  But the fries were pretty greasy.  My wife had the fish fry, really loved it and opted for the wasabi green beans, good option.  But, really nothing beyond  A-OK for me, and the no credit card thing makes Weary Traveler my standout preference.

There are fancy burgers where you wish you had just ordered a regular fast food burger and there are fancy burgers where you remember why you order fancy burgers in the first place. This place was definitely the latter. I ordered the Deluxe Applerum Burger (medium rare) and was served a deliciously messy meal. The buns - which I think come from Batch - were delicious. The patty was large and juicy. There were wonderful flavors in the burger itself. A nice sweet taste (apple), a creaminess from the aioli, and a good crunch from the veggies (pickles?). This is not a takeout burger because it would definitely not be as fresh when you get home and the bun would probably be soggy from all the delicious sauces and juices.  Aside from the burger, I enjoyed their fries as well as their wasabi green beans. We had a grilled bread appetizer and LOVED the spread. I forget what was in it aside from mushrooms, but it was definitely a great order. We liked the setup of the place and were happy to sit by the window. We had to wait for our table but there is a bar to hang out at - even eat at if you prefer. Prices were pretty fair. They had some drink specials for the day as well - we enjoyed our Moscow Mule. The staff was very nice, and they have a solid hot sauce selection if that's your thing.  Do remember that it's CASH ONLY here.

I love this place, so comfortable and "real."  The hubs and I had the special burger tonight made with Black Earth beef, portobello mushroom, spinach, Swiss cheese and onions carmelized in the Ommegang Glimmerglass beer. Are you kidding me? Who thinks of these combinations? It was SO good!  Paul had their "chips" which are their house fries, and I upgraded to the sweet potato fries. I figure I might as well go all the way if I'm going to eat a burger.  My husband loves the rotating beer taps and watches their Facebook page for updates. They go through the specials quickly, so stop in within 24 hours of them posting a special beer if you want to be sure  they have a pint for you.  They also make a great brandy old fashioned and a hopquila margarita with lemongrass ginger kombucha! Again, so creative!

The service was great. The food was tasty. My husband describes it as "above average bar food" and our impression is that the cooks here enjoy their work. I had the Chile Marinated Flank Steak and it was cooked as I had asked. The quinoa salad was creative, tasty and a great compliment to my husband's meal. The portion size was enough - not too little, not too much.

I visited Alchemy based on the recommendation of a good friend local to Madison. Based on my friend's advice most of our table ordered the skirt steak, and needless to say none of us were disappointed. The steak was perfectly cooked and the variety of beer options on tap made the experience exceptional. What put our time over the top was the fabulous waitress who provided not only great service but also lots of recommendations for things to see and do in Madison.

I'm not sure why it's my favorite burger place. Maybe it's because they have the best burgers.  The chips are great too. If they took credit cards they'd get a 5-star...it seems like a little thing but when you're doing a business lunch it's easier.  The waitstaff are very good, the bartenders are friendly and the atmosphere more like a pub than a bar.

Simply fantastic.  Super solid food, great drink selection. A favorite spot for many on the East side of Madison.  Can get crowded.  So you may have to wait for a table or something to open up at the bar.  However, worth the wait.  Or... You can enjoy another area bar while waiting.  One Barrel Brewing is just across the way.
