In 2018, how much business do you lose by not excepting credit cards? Is it some form of protest?

Fantastic! I absolutely love coming here & am never disappointed. I have yet to eat something less than delicious and memorable. My only complaint is that we never have room for dessert. And that I can't choose between menu items ;)   This place is not for you if 1) you are offended by tattoos 2) you like substituting ingredients in every dish instead of trusting the combinations planned 3) you insist on credit cards (as they only take cash, ATM on site though)... For the rest of Madison area though, enjoy!!!
Great food and decent service, but it's 2017. Shoot the lock off your wallet and let your customers pay with a credit card.

On a thrifting and antiquing girls' weekend, we "Three Amigas" sifted our way through Madison's underbelly of used and reused treasures, and found ourselves down the block from Alchemy...just when the need arose to replenish our vintage-seeking tummies.   Here's the noshing lowdown:  1. Summer special salad: mixed greens with beets, candies walnuts and goat cheese. One Amiga added brined chicken as the pièce de résistance, while one Amiga kept it simple.   2. Maize salad: mixed greens spicy garbanzo beans and cilantro, lime and chile with red onion. Me Amiga requested brined chicken as well, because treasure hunting requires protein.   Overwhelming murmurs of "oh this is so good" seasoned our conversation, as we plotted our afternoon. Our menu choices were fabulous...Alchemy conjured delicious transformations of individual ingredients into culinary deliciousness.   Merlin would approve, as do the Three Amigas.

Three star if you don't care for bar food, four if you do. I tried several items ... The soups are thick, the sandwiches are huge (same with the pasta)... But in the end this is fancy bar food. I have to say the brisket sandwich was really, really good if you loose half the bread!
Love this place, great messy, juicy burgers, homemade potato fries, strong drinks, and reasonable prices. Who could ask for more?

As in the one photo their sweet potato fries are sweet potato chips. They come with a delicious jam, but the chips are not stellar alone.  They sometimes are overcooked, not very "meaty" and some become more done than others.  One visit the oil needed changing, this could be tasted in the fries/chips themselves.  I'll still be back regardless.

Decided to come here based off of a recommendation from a friend. Parking was a breeze. Let me say this; it was a pretty hot day out and be warned that the restaurant doesn't have any AC but they do have ceiling fans. Also let me add that they only accept cash and check only.   I'll go right in, we decided to order the sweet potato fries (house sliced and twice fried sweet potatoes with tarragon mayo and local jalapeño blackberry jam) as an appetizer. This was seasoned wonderfully and sultry. Flavors of sweet and spicy. Crisp and light. For my entree I had the beer braised brisket sandwich with mustard BBQ sauce, homemade pickled egg, Swiss cheese, and snug haver spinach and red onion. The signature drinks of the day were really good.   The sandwich was DELISH with lots of flavor. Also ordered a side of steamed seasoned kale . All in all a hearty, healthy and delectable lunch. The bartender was very knowledgable and really energetic. Definitely would recommend to anyone in Madison and I would go back again. The only reason I'm giving them a 4 is because of the AC and cash only, otherwise this place is easily a 4.5 stars.

A solid 3 stars.  I'm not sure where these 4 & 5 star reviewers are eating--or not eating-- if they think this food is that good.   Alchemy tries to be something it is not.  I totally get what they are trying to do, but its not exactly working.  There are so many ingredients, which I believe are supposed to make the food experimental, but the flavors don't blend or play off of each other.  They work against each other.  For example, the "stuffed grilled cheese"- which was basically a raw vegetable sandwich with cheese- had 2 kinds of cheese, which cancelled each other out.  The pesto mayo just confused the situation.  The quinoa salad sounded good in theory, but not in execution.  Tasted like soap.  The over-hyped sweet potato fries were good, but nothing that hasn't been done before.  Of the 3 items, those are the only I would order again.  The 2 dipping choices, while as offbeat as they were striving for, didn't compliment the fries.  In this case, they didn't ruin them either though.  It worked out ok but more by luck than any kind of culinary skill.     Food came out quickly, prices were ok.  I wouldn't be opposed to giving them 1 more try, but its not like I'm in a hurry to come back.    I get that they are trying to be "Madison", but if you have to try, maybe you shouldn't.  Edit: I realize this comes across a little harsh, but that's only because of the (somewhat unbelievable) glowing reviews.  The food isn't bad, but with so many better options in Madison (and on this street alone), it just isn't a top pick for food.

Great place! Good food, but if busy it can be very uncomfortable - close quarters. As well, it was cash only the last time I was there, which is fine - I understand why they do it, but in the 2016 C.E., I personally carry cash "never."   If you can get over the 1950s cashier mechanics, it's an awesome place. Great for an afternoon beer.
Great beer selection.  It's hard for me to branch out and get something else besides the stuffed grilled cheese sandwich.  Try the Wasabi green beans as a side!

I have passed by this bar numerous times and would say "we need to stop here sometime for date night" to my hubby. Well, we finally did and it did not disappoint!!  This place was PACKED on a Sunday night. We found two seats at the bar and ordered ourselves some drinks. Now if you have ever been to NOLA you know the drinks are cheap and stiff and Alchemy reminded me of the cocktails there. I was good with my one drink. We ordered the sweet potato fries and batch bake house bread for apps. The "fries" were more like soft baked sweet potato wedges. Served with an aioli and jalapeño blackberry jam. We LOVED this!! Sweet potatoes are my favorite starchy vegetable and these were prepared so well. The dipping sauces were fabulous. I could have bought a jar of both to take home. For our main course we got the stuffed grilled cheese with their seasonal salad as a side. We decided to split this. The portion was very generous and they really do stuff that grilled cheese. It had broccoli, carrots, tomatoes not your usual run of the mill grilled cheese.  The only thing that's a bummer about this place - CASH ONLY and really small dining area and they always seem to be packed (I guess that's a good thing too).

I picked up my friend from the airport and she was pretty hungry so we looked for a place close by.  Parking spots close by were full so we parked a little down the street.  Not too far though to walk and it was a beautiful day.  The restaurant was really cool with different chairs and seating, multiple sections were up a couple stairs and you could overlook the place.  Everyone was welcoming.   The food was delicious with non typical menu items.  We both had different grilled cheeses, mine was a normal one and my friends was dressed up with carrots, tomatoes and other items.  Both again were really good along with the sides we chose.  Great experience.  Just as a side not me they do not take credit cards but have an atm and they do not split checks so be prepared for that.  It was not a problem for us but may be for some.   I will definitely be back.

Amazing food at a super price. Had Maise salad and stuffed grilled cheese with cous cous salad side.  Everything was super delicious. Fast service. Friendly environment. Super airbnb host recommendation. Would highly recommend to all. Just bring cash:)
Excellent food, good beer selection. Cash only, but they have an ATM in the dining area. A great spot for large or small groups.
Great burgers and a decent drink list. Nice ambiance too, never had a bad experience here. Cash only though, so that kinda sucks.

What keeps me coming back?  Hmm, perhaps the fresh food? The simple yet delicious specials?  Or maybe the friendly staff and quick service?  Yup, yup, yup. I have nothing but amazing things to say about the Alchemy.  This is not a place for the finicky eaters. I am impressed by the seasonal fare. The veggie of choice on your special is usually the seasonal vegetable.   The fresh food is apparent and is in an incredible value. For $15, I ordered a braised short rib with shiitake Parmesan risotto and mustard glazed Brussels sprouts. I have never so willingly eaten Brussels sprouts in my life.   They serve Honeybee bakery desserts. I had the vanilla raspberry cheesecake. My only complaint?  That I did not get two slices. Parking is doable in the area. They do not have an official lot but I have never had a problem getting a spot within a block of the area. You will probably need a little walk after eating all of their delicious food.   On another visit I ordered a burger with greens. Their seasonal dressing was a tangerine vinaigrette. I found myself eating the greens instead of the burger. Alchemy's motto should be: Getting everyone to eat their veggies.  I will go back. Again and again.

Wow. Went here with family while visiting Madison last week. Hit this place because it was Friday, in Lent, and they have cod! The place is smallish so get there early. It fills up fast. Clean it is. Nice staff. Great menu.  I had the clam chowder as a starter it was very nice. Rich and creamy although a few less potatoes and more clams are my preference. It had a real nice finish with a bit of a peppery kick.  My sister ordered the house fries and we shared them. I was so glad I got more with my entree. They are cooked and seasoned perfectly.  My meal was the fried cod with the aforementioned fries and the house made slaw.  This included four huge pieces of fish. Fantastically flavored. Great batter and light flakey fish. Terrific! The slaw was creamy and gad a bit of spice to it. Really complimented the fish?  Great selection on the fairly priced menu. Full bar too. We had a nice bottle of Chardonnay with our meal. $20. Seriously? Great price there!  Keep it up. We will return! Everyone enjoyed it and we will be back.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Madison. My fiancé and I always use a special occasion as an excuse to come here, but you really don't need one. First things first, always bring cash or a debit card here because they are cash only. They do provide an ATM inside. The beer list is always fun; they are continually changing their tap lists rotating around local, and sometimes, hard-to-find beers. I love how they source locally (ex. they use Madison Sourdough for their bread on sandwiches) and their eclectic mix of comfort food and healthy options. The burgers are always a great choice. If the special is good, that's what I usually get. Their food is always fresh and tasty. We love the Atwood neighborhood, and always love supporting this local joint.

Alchemy is a modest hole-in-the-wall, located a couple miles east of downtown Madison. They serve American favorites, including wings, burgers, and sandwiches, in a bar-like setting. I had their bison burger with sweet potato fries and I was impressed by the quality of my meal. The fries were like thick potato chips, served with two delicious sauces. The burger was cooked perfectly, and the bun and toppings were fresh.   Their bar list is really distinctive - with unusual varieties (such as New Glarus cherry stout) from various local breweries. Don't miss their desserts: I tried a cherry chocolate pie and pumpkin cheesecake, both of which tasted homemade.   It's true that they don't accept credit cards and that the place is a bit dirty and run down, but I highly recommend Alchemy if you bring an open mind and the right expectations.
3 for 3 on good meals here.  The sweet potato fries are almost too expensive but we've never regretted ordering them.  They have a couple vegan options too.

This place is perfect, if I lived anywhere nearby I'd come all the time. Great alcohol selection, great good, live music, and all really reasonably priced. Beer wise, not only is their selection really extensive but you have the option to get most of the draft beers in smaller sizes to get a wider sample (one of my favorite optios at any bar). The burger was huge and delicious, cooked perfectly. The servers take on a huge number of tables but are super efficient, checking in with you exactly when you need them and not when you don't. Music wise, don't worry that you're going to miss the 10pm start, the band had just started to play at 10 and was at least an hour late. That said, we barely got a table at 10 so you might need to come early to grab at seat at this amazing bar.

This place turned us into future customers...  It was our first time visiting.    We enjoyed the food, the atmosphere of the place, and the unique crafty food and rare beer this place offers.  We went with the stuffed grilled cheese with their homemade fries and the Tinman Bison burger with garlic mashed potatoes.  Also I recommend the wasabi green beans to try.  Both were cooked to perfection!  Flavors were delish and fresh.  We will be stopping back again soon!  A great craft food and drink place in Madison!

Visited two weeks ago, on the Saturday night after New Years.  Standard 20 minute wait, but quick service at bar, so we were fine passing the time until a table was ready. She had the applerum burger and a great salad.  i went with the Boat House chicken and house fries.  Got some aioli for the fries as well.  Great food, great drink, great atmosphere.  Bring cash.

I was looking forward to trying Alchemy for dinner last Friday after having drinks there a few weeks ago. There was about a 20 minute wait for a table, which I don't mind for a Friday night and by the time we were seated the crowd had thinned out a bit. Our server was with us right away for a drink order but kind of took her time to get back to us for a dinner order. None of us thought too much of it until it took 45 minutes to get our food after ordering. Two of us ordered sandwiches (a BFLT and a grilled cheese) and one of us ordered the Fish Fry so we didn't think it should take that long. When we got our food it was cold and it was a shame because it seemed like it would have tasted good. I will be back for cocktails but not dinner. The service was was just too bad.

I had high hopes, but sadly they weren't met. I am a big believer in judging a place, at least initially, on their burgers. I had a basic bacon cheeseburger with fries. The fries were great. Skin on slices of potato, clearly house made. The burger sounded promising: black earth beef. I ordered medium rare and it came out properly pink, but it was dry. I wonder if the beef was "too good" for a burger; not enough fat to make a burger juicy like it should be. The bun was fairly dry as well which didn't help. Last point: no credit cards. Normally I'm down with a no CC place, but this is a sit down dinner location and with the prices (which were perfectly fine for the vibe), you'd be looking at $50 for a date night... that is beyond cash only territory in my opinion. Glad I tried it, but not eager to return.

Easily one of my favorite places in Madison- I've tried many things on the menu & never walked away disappointed! Alchemy uses fresh and local ingredients to create interesting flavor combinations.  The sweet potato fries are a MUST order- they're delicious & perfectly paired with their sauces. Alchemy is great at using the perfect jam or aioli to complement a dish. Some of my other favorite menu items include their ribs, BBQ pulled pork sandwich, wings & house boat sandwich. They also offer a wide selection of drinks. Food & drinks are very reasonably priced.   Alchemy has a great atmosphere. It's small & dark, but feels very homey & comfortable. Alchemy is cash only so be sure to bring cash or your debit card. An ATM is available.

I tend to either have the stuffed grilled cheese, the applerum burger, or their Friday fish fry each time I come (or carryout from) here. My favorite item has to be the stuffed grilled cheese sandwich, which is smothered with fresh veggies and layered in melted cheddar and swiss. Truly think it's the best stuffed grilled cheese in all of Madison.  Alchemy also has a signature jalapeño jam that is so delicious with their sweet potato fry appetizer. A real bonus is that you can purchase a jar of this jam for only 5 bucks. I have like 60.  Definitely my favorite spot to frequent. Although quite small and sometimes crowded I have not once been disappointed with taste, atmosphere, or service. If I could give more than five stars I would.

I love them. Alchemy is a great no frills late night eatery and music venue. They have a wide variety of musical genres where you can catch some free tunes. The food is great too. I rarely stray from their burgers and philosophers stone cocktail. Only complaint is sometimes the service can be super slow, even when they're not all that busy.

I love to frequent the Alchemy. They have a solid beer selection and an interesting menu. Solid stop in the Atwood area.  Also - the interior has an aura of mystique to it at night. Also features rotating artwork which keeps it fresh. I'd give it the thumbs up.

The best food in Madison for the price.  HANDS DOWN.  This fresh and flavorful menu cannot be beaten, and the beer selection is wonderful with an ever-changing variety  that can only be rivaled by a few gastropubs in the area.  It's easy to spend 3 times more on beer than your food, but so so so worth it.  If you haven't eaten here, GO!  I love all of their sides, but my favorite is the house salad.  It is usually boring at most places, but here you almost forget about your dinner while eating it.  AWESOME.  You must try: Sweet Potato Fries:  Thin sliced fries with  jalapeno berry jam and spiced mayo sides (perfectly delicious)  Tarragon Ham Sandwich:  Deliciously sweet, hot, and thick sliced homemade ham with a tarragon mayo  with tomatoes on a baguette (sinful)  TinShack Smokehouse Burger:  I was having a food-gasm while I was eating this, but I recall there being smoked carmelized onions with muenster cheese, some sort of spiced cream sauce, all on top of a perfectly rare bison burger patty.  All of this in between a nice black sesame bun.  Yummy!  I could keep going on all day about this menu, and their daily specials are local, fresh, and amazingly cheap.  Go there now if you haven't already.  The only negative to this place is the difficulty in finding a table.  If you don't come before 6 or 6:30 during the week, good luck fitting in a table of more than 3 or 4.  I haven't even braved it during the weekend supper rush, so take your chances if you will, it's worth it.
Great food for a decent price!  Good beer selection ( need a couple more double IPAs).

Wow! I have to say this is one of my favorite restaurants in Madison. Don't sleep on their wings! Ridiculously flavorful and spicy. Also they might seem pricey but you could easily split them between four. The sauce tastes like a mix between mole and buffalo sauce and it tastes like spicy heaven. As far as other dishes I have explored most of the sandwich options. Personal favorite is the kimchi Reuben... amazing. Also I love the cucumber quinoa salad as a side mmmmm. Excellent tap list as well and cocktails. Can't wait to return!

Alchemy has decent food and a great selection of beers.  My review is more about their late-nite role as a live-music venue.  Here is an unfortunately common experience.  Alchemy advertises a band at 10PM.  I show up at 10:30, expecting a little late start.  No band in sight.  Ask about that and am told the band will start "around 11:00".  They let the band start to set up around 10:45.  By 11:30, still no band but seems we're closer.  Unfortunately I give up so I cannot report what time exactly the band started.    This is not a band-related issue.  It is a club related issue.  Please, if you are going to have music at 11:45, then don't advertise it for 10PM.  Music takes a secondary at best role for this bar.

This place was great. SO many amazing options on the menu.  I got the coconut curry which was everything I imagined it would be. (However, some of the squash seemed under cooked?) My partner got the portabella sandwich. He loved it at the time but it may have made him a little ill.   I would go again. Good happy-hour and ambiance. Quaint little place.

We were there initially for an event, than decided to stay for dinner. All the staff that was around that evening were helpful and seemed to have good camaraderie - making for a fun, relaxed atmosphere.   We had the flank steak, rare (yum!), and they allowed us to substitute the seasonal veggies for their awesome green beans.

This place has all the hallmarks of a college bar except it's nowhere near a college and no one is of college age. Slow service, grungy space, cash only. This is probably a local bar but the locals can do better.

Had a bison burger with a side of salad. I asked for it medium rare, but I got it well done, which I ended up not minding too much because the bun and the toppings were just right. Well balanced in texture and flavor and perfectly stacked. Salad was a real salad with beets and candied nuts and goat cheese and not just greens, which was kind of nice.  BF had fried perch sandwich. It looked delicious, but he ate it all before I could try it. I could try the fries though. They were nothing like regular fries, but they were delicious!  I think I will be back!
Solid spot for drinks and burgers.  It's a great atmosphere - warm, bustling.   Great Moscow Mules.

Good drinks. The perch sandwich was bizarre. The bread slices were bigger than my bedroom pillows, and sadly the perch was very under sized. The fish looked like 4 goldfish fillets. Inexcusable plating Mr. Chef!

I am surprised that a lot of people did not like the decor.  It is a nice, dark, wood-based bar and I am always a fan of that.    I didn't have the soup, but one of the people that I was with knows the woman who makes them and he said they are very good.  I had the stuffed grilled cheese which I have to say didn't do much for me.  The filling was delicious, but the bread was cut so thickly that I felt like I had eaten an entire loaf by the end of the meal.  One of my friends had a burger, the other the hangar steak, and they both raved over them.  The garlic mashed potatoes were very good.  This is a lovely place to just hang out and have a beer and sandwich.

I've never had a bad meal here. In fact, I've never had a meal here that was just OK. The food is consistently delicious, the service is friendly, and the atmosphere is comfortable. If you go, consider getting the wasabi green beans. They are awesome.
The house old fashion ed's ROCK! I always tell all my friends to go here for the Friday fish fry. Awesome drink selection, dark and trendy atmosphere, great location, and live music some nights.

After reading the great reviews about Alchemy's stuffed grilled cheese and BLFT I had to come try them both for myself.  On the first occasion I came in and ordered the stuffed grilled cheese with a side salad. The side salad with beets and walnuts was amazing. However, the stuffed grilled cheese had a bunch of carrots and onions inside which was not tasty to me and I looooooove grilled cheeses! I wish it had a majority of broccoli in it like it says it has rather than so many carrots in it.   On my second trip here I ordered the BLFT and was also disappointed on the rave. The fried tomato tasted super oily and did not compliment the sandwich like I thought it would. Instead it made it much more of a mess to eat and try to keep all the pieces together.   Their desserts sound amazing, but both times they were out. Their mixed drinks are very reasonably priced and all sound so delicious. The service was great both times that I sat at the bar to eat. If I do return, it will be to try their mixed drinks.   Cash only, plus their ATM only charges $1 fee! First time I've seen the fee so low.

AWESOME. Seriously. Great food, attentive service, fun location.   It is always pretty busy, especially between 7 and 8 on Thursdays and Fridays. If you want the daily specials, arrive a little early because they often run out by later in the night. THEY DO NOT TAKE CARDS OF ANY TYPE, ONLY CASH. There is an ATM right in the middle of the restaurant in case you need it, but just bring cash to simplify things.   The food: Clam chowder - tons of clam and super tasty Maize salad - huge, just the right amount of dressing, and a little spicy Fish fry - 4 large pieces of battered fish with fries Apple rum burger - flavorful and juicy Sweet potato fries - pretty good, although a little unevenly cooked  Definitely worth a visit!
stuffed grilled cheese is one of the best choices for my vegetarian family. tomato basil soup was excellent. don't forget to top it all off with a Bloody Mary. just don't drive after drinking it!

Alchemy was suggested by my daughter who lives locally and has enjoyed this restaurant. Except for a pretty loud atmosphere (bar is adjacent to eating area), this place is as close to wonderfulness as a place could get. Staff are great! Amanda explained dishes to us and service was quick and helpful. We enjoyed Canyon Rd Chardonnay, appetizers of a zingy clam chowder ( after all it was Friday Fish Fry night in the midwest!!), house fries, the fish fry meal of cod and I myself devoured a cucumber/cilantro/quinoa salad plus the roasted butternut squash coconut curry, which is so delicious. I have always said to my friends, Los Angeles has nothing on Madison for food, style, or fun things to do. Alchemy could plunk down in any city and please everyone. They accept personal checks and cash- and there is an ATM right there to save you if you realize while choing down you used your last cash moolah to pay for your organic baby diaper carrier, parking, or the Badger Bus from Milwaukee. Believe me- it was a seating challenge but the table with bench was perfect: we had a baby, 4 adults and it was Friday at 5:00... This place is crazy good!!!

It took me 3 years before I found Alchemy. In the past 7 months, I've been there at least 15 times.  Great beer selection, friendly service, and CASH ONLY (note the caps for emphasis). I learned pretty quickly.  But, most importantly--the food! All local, all delicious. However, there's one standout: the sweet potato fries. YOU MUST ORDER THEM. Seriously. Even if you're somehow deathly allergic to sweet potatoes, they're worth a brush-up with death.  Yeah, that good. Alchemy rules.
LOVE IT! Great food, great drinks, great music, you can't go wrong!  I particularly enjoy their sour nights for a chance to try some hard to find sours!

Whenever I come to Alchemy I hope to get something new, because all the food looks so good, but I like the sweet potato fries and corn salad so much I always stick to those. If you like sweet potato in any form, the sweet potato fries here are on point. These are some of the best sweet potato fries in town; they're crispy, well-seasoned, and come with a spicy jam that makes my mouth so happy. The corn salad has a tangy, super unique tasting dressing that I love. It's large enough for a full dinner and has tons of protein for vegetarians or those avoiding meat.  Overall, Alchemy is a great place for a quick dinner, especially with a few people. There are usually at least a few tables free and I never wait more than a few minutes even with a slightly larger group. The food is varied enough for a picky group and everything is pretty good (sandwiches, burgers, salads, larger entrees). The beer menu is pretty sizable and desserts are delicious. They have music a few nights a month too in the evening, which makes it a fun evening hangout.   The only thing I don't love is the space and layout. Some of the tables are pretty close to one another and, for some reason, the space always feels kind of loud and a little difficult to hear people.

This restaurant/pub is a quaint local neighborhood joint. I think they decided on the name Alchemy because the magic that's performed in the kitchen! My wife and I happened on it by mistake. Thank Goodness we did!   I decided to try the Pad Thai (1st day on menu), I'm soooo very glad I did, AMAZING! This Pad Thai could give any street vendor in Thailand a run for their money. The best I've ever had in the states!   My wife ordered the grilled cheese sandwich, it was an amazing flavorful concoction, she also ordered the side of cucumber quinoa salad, Fantastic also! The staff and servers where attentive and Amazingly sweet!  The kitchen alchemists who conjured this Pad Thai dish deserve 10 stars and a page in the big book of Happiness! That's exactly what this Pad Thai did, made me very very happy!!   Congratulations to the chef for concocting this wonderful dish! Splendid!

Really solid food with big portions, nice ambience, and friendly service. Also cash only, but they do have an atm onsite.  I had the beer braised brisket with fries and my wife had the smoke house burger with the seasonal salad.    The brisket sandwich was excellent. The brisket was nice and tender and really heaped on the sandwich. Initially I was worried the mustard bbq sauce was going to dominate all the other flavors in the sandwich, but it was actually really well balanced. The house picked eggs were not a particular strong flavor however. Not bad, but not an amazing addition either. Lastly, this sandwich was messy. With the generous portions that wasn't surprising, but ask for some extra napkins, or don't wear your favorite shirt.  The house cut fries were a good addition as a side. Nice crispness, but I threw some extra salt on them.  The tastes I had of my wife's burger and salad was also excellent. She has been talking been talking about how great it was for the last half hour. The smoked and caramelized onions were really the star here. Great smokey flavor!  The side salad was also great, especially the blueberry dressing. Again, the portions quelled my worry about the price.  The ambience was nice, with a not overly pretentious gastro pub vibe. There was also a box with some boardgames that were call my name.  Service was also really good. The waitress was really friendly, brought the food out quickly and kept our drinks full, even with a big lunch crowd.  Overall, I am really excited to come back and try some of the other really tempting choices (the boat house and the perch tacos especially) as well some delicious looking cocktails.

I had a very nice lunch at Alchemy. I had the fried perch sandwich and it was delicious. My one complaint is that I might have preferred a thinner slice of bread because it was a bit overpowering. Overall the balance of the flavors of the sandwich was nice and I would definitely order it again.  My mom went with the stuffed grilled cheese and Alchemy fries, both of which she really enjoyed! I got a chance to try the fries, which were crispy yet still soft and absolutely amazing!  The star of my meal at Alchemy was the daily soup special, a coconut, beet and ginger puree. The waitress let us a sample the soup before ordering it, which I really appreciated. Upon my first bite I was so in love that I ordered a bowl on the spot and proceeded to finish the whole thing. It was amazing!  I really enjoyed the atmosphere and food at Alchemy and will definitely return to experience their outdoor seating this summer.

I can't get enough of this place! It is open every day from 11:30 to bar time, the food is fantastic and the wait staff is super friendly!  Beer selections frequently change-which is a plus.  My family loves the place--we have been here multiple times since we first came here after the UW Spring Game in 2013.    I highly recommend the grilled Batch Bakehouse specials, and the Tin Shack Chicken Sandwich.  Alchemy fries are a great side as well. Don't get me wrong-they also have great salads and some vegetarian friendly options too.   Only drawback is  you have to remember to bring cash (though there is an ATM next to the bar-not sure what the fees are).

So my sister and I were traveling through Madison and we starving.  We found Alchemy, and I figured it was a type of place we'd both maybe like - we did ...  Overall Pros ...  unpretentious place, good food, reasonable prices, nice menu, reasonable beer prices.  Overall Cons ...  Didn't see any signage about the lack of credit card acceptance.  It's OK that they are a cash place, but make it obvious on the menus.  Yes, that cash dispensing machine is there, but what if you only have a credit card and you don't ever use it for cash and don't know your pass code, of even if you have a pass code?  Service was good, but we were not asked if we wanted a second round of drinks (we did) and we were not offered more water (which I needed).  Also the waitress we had was attentive but since we were outside and she was attending to patrons both inside and out, we waited a rather long time for her to come and accept our payment - I finally walked inside and tried to pay by credit card and learned it was cash only.    So my sister had the basmati rice with vegetable curry $10, and she loved it - especially the yogurt sauce.  Washed it down with a pale ale from Longmont, CO and it was only $4 - which was a nice surprise.  In the Chicago area we'd pay $6 for the same glasses of beer on tap.   I had the hanger steak on fries with zucchini and blue cheese.  The portions were just right I thought, and the steak was prepared well, but the fries were not fries about $14.  They were disc-like in shape, over cooked by a lot, hard, greasy, no flavor and very disappointing. I had a non alcoholic beer and at $3.50 it was perfect for me.     I would return if I come back to Madison. There are other restaurants in the vacinity I'd like to try too, but I would come back to Alchemy first - with cash next time, and I would bypass the 'fries'. .

Alchemy is a great little gem in the Atwood neighborhood. They have a really great selection of beers that changes all the time, and I would argue one of the best Friday Fish Fries in Madison. The menu is casual, but everything is really delicious. The bison burger never disappoints, the sweet potato fries are killer (raspberry jalapeno jam dip is freaking amazing), the chicken wings are ENORMOUS, and the wasabi green beans are a kickass side.  Don't accept credit cards, so bring cash. Waitstaff are always great and super attentive, but it gets busy and fills up fast, so get there early or be prepared to have a drink at the bar while you wait.

Meh. Overrated place due to cool location. I ordered the Vietnamese rice noodle salad, one of my favorite dishes of all time, and it was a huge disappointment here. We had to wait a very long time for the food to come out, and I found this place to be very loud- more like a bar atmosphere than somewhere to go for dinner. This place would be ok if you were just going for music and drinks, but I would not eat here again.

Alchemy is one of my very, very favorite dining/imbibing establishments anywhere.  Everything here is somewhere on the spectrum of excellent to amazing.  The staples on the daily menu are fantastic - their burgers are some of Madison's very best, and the specials, oh, the specials!  You have to go early because people are onto this place and they sell out fast.  It's worth the effort to get there, and it's worth the wait, even if it's crowded (it often is).  Bring cash or your ATM card.  The beer list rivals the food menu, with often-rotating beers including some that aren't seen often.  It's definitely one of the best tap lineups in town, and this is a beer town.    Alchemy is a very casual, unassuming tavern that doesn't necessarily tip you off to what awaits you when you order, and that's part of what makes it such a cool place.    This is a somewhat short review but that shouldn't imply there's not a lot to say about Alchemy, because I could go on and on.  You'll be glad you don't have a lot to read because you'll get there sooner!

This is by far my favorite lunch or dinner spot on a dime. If you are looking for delish, local food for a reasonable price, this is the spot. They make everything in house. They are a cash or check-only spot, but they do have an ATM. I recommend the BLFT with quinoa. Who doesn't love a beer-battered fried tomatoes?? And they use cilantro in their quinoa...so good! The coconut curry is also fantastic. But so is everything on the menu. The service and atmosphere is wonderful as well. Love this place!!

The Alchemy seems misplaced in the Atwood area.  Most restaurants and bars in the area are delightfully quirky in decor....the Alchemy had the kind of forced, faux-pub atmosphere that you might find in Middleton or a sports bar/brew pub on the south side.  Don't get me wrong: It's not *bad*.  It's just...odd.  Weird placement/decor/atmosphere aside, I'm okay with this bar.  I would happily return to eat some of the seriously delicious-looking food.  As it was, we were only there for drinks.  The beer selection had some very different choices, which was refreshing.  I was impressed that the wine list had a variety of good wines at $5.75/glass or $20/bottle.  The waitress was *adorable* and so, so nice.  It was a nice place to kick back for drinks after dinner.
Awesomeness! Food=great! Try them sweet-tater fries!
This place is so cool! All the food was great. I had the stuffed grilled cheese and it was 10/10 stars. AMAZING

I give this five stars for a Sunday night, but four stars on a weekend night.  Here is what's up.  It was 9 pm on Sunday night, having just dropped off my last Uber passenger I needed a decent meal.  Stopped at Tex Tubb's and they were closing, so across the street I ventured to a place that was always too crowded to even approach on Friday or Saturday night - The Alchemy.  And on a Sunday night, after a long day, it truly was a slice of heaven.  The bartender...quick and nice.  The waitress who was not even serving me, very nice and quick (food and drinks were picked up immediately when ready).  My food was out in a matter of minutes.  I love good service.  And there were people at the bar, people the bartender knew and to whom he chatted, but that never took away from my service.  I ordered the fish tacos and they were delicious; just a great combination of flavor that I really enjoyed.    The beer menu was fantastic and the two beers I chose were outstanding.  I would go back just for the beer menu alone.  On a Sunday night, with the prospect of my regular job hassles beginning in 9 hours, a place with high quality food, high quality drink, great service and a relaxed atmosphere was just what I needed.  As Arnold said (again and again)...I'll be back!

Update: some one sent me a negative "compliment" on Yelp! calling me some really fun names and saying the "no cards" policy is at the top of the menu. It may be there NOW, but it wasn't when we were there. You know how I know that? Because when I complained to the waitress about the cash-only policy not being on the door, where it SHOULD be posted, she would have told me it was on the menu. She didn't.  Also, I'm a very careful reader (I'm an auditor by trade)- I would have seen it, and so would my coworker. So nice try, but no. Besides, the larger point still stands: not accepting cards, in 2014, where more consumer transactions are by credit or debit card (42%) than by cash (40%) (stats as of 2012, I'm sure the gap is much wider now), is just friggin' STUPID, and it  inconveniences customers. Why would you do that??? Oh yeah-- you'd do it to keep from documenting all your transactions to avoid paying taxes. Or at least some people would. I'm sure these fine folks would never engage in such unseemly activity.  -------------------------------------  I was sitting here writing a 5-star review for this place while I waited for the check. I had three really good paragraphs on how good the food was. And then everything changed.   "Sorry, we're cash and check only. We don't accept cards."  I cannot begin to properly articulate the absurdity of this. Seriously??? In 20 frickin' 14, when lots of people don't carry currency, much less check books, you don't accept cards? Really???  And to make it worse, THERE'S NO SIGN AT THE ENTRANCE warning patrons of this ridiculous policy. So you are done eating and in their debt before you realize that you're boned.    Anyway, the waitress says there's an ATM on premise, but it only works sometimes. Yeah, well, it didn't work for me or my coworker.   So next we were directed to a bank down the street with an ATM. Luckily, some other diners told us about a much closer place across the street with an ATM.  So after being embarrassed in front of all the folks sitting around us and walking across the street to withdraw money (and paying a fee to do so), I was finally free of this awful place.   Good food or not, I'd never go back because they don't have the courtesy to forewarn people about their nonsensical payment terms. Unreal.  Also, if our server is reading this, you got a minuscule tip because I deducted the $3 in ATM fees I lost over this episode, plus $1 for the embarrassment and $1 for having to walk to an ATM. I know you didn't make the no cards policy, so it's not technically your fault, but you were sort of unsympathetic (my coworker said uppity) about it, and perhaps this will cause you to encourage your bosses to reconsider this foolishness.

I would have given five stars, but they don't accept Credit Cards - Cash and Check only.  Service at the bar was ok, he seemed a bit annoyed we didn't know straight away what we wanted and slid the beer menu towards us. Once we ordered our drinks he did smile and thank us. Saved by the smile.  There was a wait, but the restaurant was dark enough so we didn't feel like we were on a stage waiting on display. They cleared tables quickly patrons didn't seem to linger too long, perhaps because you couldn't really run up a tab here due to cash and check only. (maybe it is a good thing)  The server we had was timely, pleasant and patient. She even settled a table bet about the type of ketchup that was in the generic refillable bottle - it was Heinz! A+ in my book. However, the fries were so good, that I didn't need the ketchup.  Nachos were delicious and spicy.  My salmon BLT was tasty and FILLING. (see picture). Salmon was a big piece in delicious multigrain bread and the bacon, well, it was just perfect. Something about the midwest and their bacon. THEY DO BACON RIGHT!!!  Everyone at the table seemed to enjoy their meals as well and of course the beer. Nice selection of local craft beer!  Waitress seemed to be right there whenever we thought to look for her. Cashed us out promptly and with a smile.  If/When I return to Madison, I will definitely return.

Two things: when you come here, bring cash. And come hungry.  If they didn't only take cash, they'd have 5 stars from me. But as it stands, the food and drinks make it well worth the effort to find on-street parking in this trendy and slightly-annoying-to-drive-in neighborhood (yeah, I'm a snob about private lots--nobody's perfect!).  Order the fresh-blended Bloody Mary with a bison burger. They've also got some INCREDIBLE vegetarian choices.   This is by far my favorite restaurant in the Atwood area (and there are a few that are runners-up to each other, but none that compare to Alchemy). Stop in after an evening class at the Midwest Clay Project or Ford's Gym.  :)

Hung out at the Alchemy last night with friends. Food is flavorful with a small variety of most protein options done one or two different ways. Sweet potato fries were amazing and the bluegill tacos and 'houseboat' their chicken sandwich that has plenty of char and a jalapeño aioli. Tap beer menu consists of about a dozen brews ranging from Pilsner to double IPAs, all Midwest craft brews.  Fun, sit-down atmosphere and bar space, in a fun neighborhood.

I love spending the evening here with good friends and good beer. It is lively but laid back and the food is delicious. Get the Matilda. It's sooo good. The first time I went to Alchemy, I got the salmon and immediately experienced order regret after I tasted the Matilda. The side veggies and salads are always really good as well. The bison burger is similarly on point. It's a good time, as long as you're willing to get a drink an wait at the bar if its a weekend night.

What happened?  This place went from being one of our favorite places to eat and everything was great and in the past 2 weeks everything appears to have tanked.  Same menu, not the same food. Very sad, hope they can fix whatever poor decision led them astray.  Update to the review above, I'm not yet changing my rating or my comments but will say that the kitchen manager from the Alchemy replied asking for clarification which is a good sign and I wish them the best and hope to be able to change my rating above.  If I had written the review 3 months to a year ago would have been 5 stars.

For a bar, this place has some seriously good eats.    I agree with Heather, though, when she said that it's vibe is....different. It wasn't bad at all, just...odd. With such a great menu, I guess I expected a different decor than...well, it's hard to describe.   I ordered the BLT with beer battered tomatoes, which was very good. The garlic mayo was a little bit too garlicky for me...on a BLT, anyway. I also ordered a side of sweet potato fries, which came with tarragon mayo and a blackberry preserve sauce--which was so fabulous. The chips were really excellent, and I could have made a meal of just those.   Being the nosy person I am, I watched the waiter take several other dishes to customers. The onion rings looked awesome, and next time I'm DEFINITELY getting a stuffed grilled cheese!  Go for the food, even if you're a bit thrown off by the setting!

I would be perfectly happy if I could eat nothing but soup, salad, and fries from the Alchemy for the rest of my life (which is convenient, as I work right next door.) Their pork belly chowder is truly a revelation!

Alchemy never disappoints.  From a ever changing beer menu to their very solid menu (heavy on the sandwiches), Alchemy fires on all cylinders.  Be forewarned...it is not a huge place so it fills up quickly and they don't accept credit cards (but there is an ATM onsite). Last Saturday, I started off with the sweet potato fries.  Homemade and twice fried, they were absolutely delicious.  It is accompanied by two different sauces for your dipping pleasure-one a tarragon mayo, the other a jalapeno-blackberry jam.  On their own or together, they rock. My entree was the Tinhouse Smokeshack Burger,  A bison burger topped with smoke and carmelized onions, green peppercorn bacon, greens and muenster, the burger was ever better than the description.  I have been there too many times to count and the consistency shines through.  Be also to try their homemade desserts as well as their daily soup and entree specials. One of my go-to places...you can't go wrong!

The best sweet potato fries I've ever had! They were served with a blackberry jalapeño jam that was amazing! The grilled cheese was fantastic dipped on the blackberry jalapeño jam! A definite stop anytime I'm in Maddison!
The Alchemy was highly recommended from Madison locals, and now I know why. Maize salad =

Alchemy is definitely A-OK but nothing better.   First, there's always a long wait for a table so don't try to get in on a weekend evening without planning on hanging out at the (small) bar for awhile and grabbing a cocktail or beer.   Second, the food is good but not spectacular... except for the pate special! Whatever kind of crack they put into it, it's always amazing and the bread is perfectly toasted and delish.   Third, the ambiance is pretty good overall, and they often have live music on the weekend, which makes it a good place to go on a date or with a group.   So, really, Alchemy is a place to get food that sometimes is tasty. Overall, MEH.

Upping my review after a great experience.  I had a cajun chicken sandwich that was wonderful.  The alchemy fries are always a treat as well.  The service was perfect.  I also appreciate their unique beer selection.  I will say it really rubbed my dining partner the wrong way that they don't take cards.  I was planning to use cash anyway so nbd to me but it's just not ok for a restaurant not to accept plastic these days.

I dined her on a wednesday night, the place was moderately busy.  We had excellent service and there was great music playing overhead!!!  I noticed on the wall there are shelves with board games and thought that was fantastic!!!   The food was good, typical gastro pub food.  I had a burger and sweet potato fries, however, my friend had some squash risotto which was AMAZING!!!  I will definitely go back!
Unique selection, awesome atmosphere, and very reasonable prices! Will definitely be going back!!

Some seriously, seriously good food. The first thing I ever tried was the BLFT - bacon, lettuce, FRIED TOMATO. I bow down to the genius who decided to put their next-level batter to use on a tomato. Chewy bread, crispy thick bacon, and veggies that don't taste like water. My mouth is watering just typing this.   I also recommend the Stuffed Grilled Cheese. Served on the same chewy bakery sourdough with pesto, two cheeses, and a boatload of veggies in the middle. Salivating again. Why am I not closing my computer and heading there right now?   Don't sleep on the Alchemy fries - they're thinner than wedge fries but thicker than potato chips. I've heard great things about the sweet potato fries as well but I'm often at Alchemy on Fridays and they ditch the sweet potatoes to make room for fish fry.   The only things holding it back from being five stars for me is that it's often too crowded with no good place to wait (you either have to hover awkwardly by the door or stand way too close to someone along the bar) and it's often so loud it's a struggle to carry on a conversation without shouting. The food is so fantastic, though, that I'll wait and shout. Happily.
Great food (unique burgers, good veggie dishes, great salads), great local beers, pretty good deserts too

This place is a great place to order some fries and a burger. The burgers and fries have an awesome taste that isn't like any other restaurant. The other things on the menu I wasn't impressed on but the burgers and fries are just fabulous. Service is good and has a nice variety of drinks at the bar. Just a good place to have burgers and fries.

I'd actually give Alchemy a 3.5 with a nod to sourcing locally. I always find the service to between so so and OK. The quality of the food is great, but the portion size can be pretty modest on some of the menu items for the price.   I had the Bison Bacon Burger today. I'm a big fan of bison. I ordered rare and it came out a solid medium. This is a hazard of almost every Madison kitchen - over cooking burgers. This is especially important with bison. The patty could also have been more aggressively seasoned. At $10.50 with a choice of sides, it's a top end burger, given that the Alchemy is right across the street from Player's, which is perhaps the best burger joint in town (albeit no bison at Player's).   I'm sure I'll be back - I'm interested I trying the fried green tomato BLT.

The best homemade "fries". They are thin cut but wide. Extremely well seasoned. Not soggy. Still have some of the potato skins on them. Generous portions but not gluttonous. So delicious, I could eat these all the time and I'm not the biggest fries person.  The rest of the food here is usually pretty good. Creative dishes, not pretentious environment, someone is paying attention in the kitchen.

Visiting Madison and came across this place. Very "Hipster" place...they don't even take Credit Cards! Food was good, service was very good, and tap lost was unique. Had the special of the day which were Flank Steak tacos. 3.5/5. You don't go there for the food specifically but more for the vibe of it all.

I'm a vegetarian and light beer drinker and go to Alchemy only because a group of my friends do. Alchemy is to be commended for its expansion of vegetarian items, Now I know that I won't be forced to eat a portobello sandwich, which is very tasty at Alchemy, but what vegetarian wants always to have to eat this or a veggie burger because nothing else is available for us? The maize salad is great --the small salad makes a whole meal. But the latest menu has gone too far. Alchemy should not be trying to prepare Southeast Asian food. I'm a connoisseur of it so was tempted by their Vietnamese Rice Noodle Salad. Unfortunately, it was atrocious. Avoid at all costs.

Good place to drink. Good place to eat. They have lots of good beer and excellent nightly food specials. The service is good and the place feels neighborhood-y, which I like. Sometimes they have live music and djs which bring in fun crowds. They also have fun trivia every other Sunday.

Thoughtful drinks, and great sandwiches at refreshingly affordable prices. They could probably charge nearly twice as much if they wanted to. House boat and stuffed grilled cheese are personal favorites. Cash only.

Came here before a play at the Overture theatre.  Great place, with a great neighborhood feel to it.  Great selection of sandwiches.  I had the chicken breast, and my date had the bison burger.  We ended up sharing both, and they both were great.  Highly recommend.

I can't believe I'm just now visiting this place!  This place is great.  The location is very centrally located to a lot of other eateries in the areas and if you are lucky you can find decent parking.  Upon walking I noticed that the place had a very laid back vibe.  There isn't a hostess waiting to greet you but I was quickly greeted and offered the open table.   Next I took a look at their drink menu and found a couple of unique drinks there that I mentally bookmarked for a future visit.  I ordered the steak which came with fries and a half a corn cob.   I really enjoyed the steak but was blown away by the corn.  It was so flavorful with seasoned butter and other flavors.    All in all, I really like this place.  I can't remember what my husband ordered but I know that he really enjoyed his meal. . There are lots of sandwiches and burgers on the menu that I cannot wait to try on my next visit.

Alchemy and Josh and Matthia and the rest of your effing wonderful staff, thanks for being awesome. Who knew this jumping little place would spring forth from the ruins of Wonder's? Y'all are going into your 3rd year of blissful success and I couldn't be prouder.  Keep on keeping on with your sweet potato  fries with the jam (and they are the jam), your rotating beers on tap, your salsa, burgers and your live and free @ Alchemy shows. I love you, Alchemy. I really effing do.  Cheers!

I like this place a lot. The wait can get obnoxious since it's fairly small, but the excellent beer selection at the bar makes it worthwhile. The food is great. I loooove the sweet potato fries.   The one thing I could do without is the live music. The space is way too small to be able to hold a conversation over some crappy jam band.

We stopped here for lunch today - after a morning bike ride we were really hungry! My Zaremba burger was cooked perfectly although I thought we had to wait a while for our food. This is a strange complaint, I'm sure, but I really wished my burger came with lettuce. It had bacon, cheese, and a delicious green olive and shallot spread. But no lettuce. I did ask (and got) no tomato, so maybe the lettuce got forgotten? Fries were good but unremarkable.   Our servers were very attentive (lots of refills on soda and water!) nice interior with a raised bar area; there's also a few tables outside. A few TVs but not too many. Cash only (they have an ATM) and no separate checks. You're going to have to do the math yourself! I really liked this place and I'm sure I'll be back at some point.

Great place and great food!! Their sandwiches are amazing-especially they're STUFFED GRILLED CHEESE! I want to recreate that masterpiece, but haven't been successful yet.  They're sweet potato fries are also a winner. My only criticism is the lighting situation, sometimes it's a tad bit too dark. But then again, maybe it's just me. It goes with the nice ambiance,

YUCK...skip! Easily the WORST BURGERS I've ever eaten. The burgers lacked flavor even with the toppings. We ordered: Applerum burger and Tinshack smokehouse burger. Both left a lot to be desired. The fries were not fries at all, more like potato chips (some thin and crispy & others thick). The sweet potato fries/chips were good but not  enough to return for.  POOR SERVICE. TEPID FOOD. The service left a lot to be desired also. She (the waitress) was behaving as though she was doing us a favor, oppose to her job.   The FLIES that kept landing on my plate was the last straw...I couldn't finish my food

I was ready to bitch about how they don't take credit cards, how they were a little understaffed, and how we waited 15 minutes before the waitress took our order.   But then I had my first bite of a Zaremba burger and all of my bad feelings disappeared. This was probably the best burger I've had in Madison. My only complaint is that it could use a slightly firmer bun, but that's a minor complaint indeed. Absolutely delicious food and very reasonable prices mean that we'll be back very soon!

The defining objective of alchemy is most famously known as transforming base metals into gold or silver. Alchemy the restaurant is most famously known for transforming base ingredients into delicious meals.   I've only had their burgers, which are all amazing. Even their vegetarian burgers are good. Try the Bella if you are not a meat eater; it's got a balsamic vinegar glazed portabella mushroom steak accompanied by gorgonzola ranch, fried leeks, tomato, lettuce, and swiss cheese between two soft, freshly-baked buns.   If you're looking a real burger, get the Zaremba burger (if it's still available; Alchemy's menu is seasonal and subject to change.) It's got bacon, a green olive and shallot salad, tomato and swiss sitting on top of a juicy 1/3 lb patty. Pure heaven. Add a side of cilantro cucumber quinoa salad and you have yourself the perfect meal.   In addition to amazing food, Alchemy also boasts a strong cocktail menu and beer selection. Not to mention live music some nights. If you have a Bike Benefits sticker, you get $1 off drafts. So...what are you waiting for? Come taste the magic.
Great menu with a good variety. The burger and quinoa side was amazing. Make sure you have cash, credit cards aren't accepted and checks aren't split. Highly recommend, will come again.

Quite possibly the most underrated fish fry in Madison.  They prepare it with a lighter batter that has a bit of zing to it that's really unique.  It's rare that you find a solid craft beer bar that also cranks out good food too.  I'm a huge fan!
Came for the sweet potato fries. They lived up to the hype!! The kombucha is like a light fruity tea. Cash only though! ATM is luckily located inside! Bartender Noel was awesome!

A place where there is something for everyone. Super comfortable atmosphere with lots of daylight, wooden alcoves, and board games to play. Locally sourced food and artwork, which is always a good thing! Our service was good and both the meat and tofu burgers were great! Great variety of adult beverages. Cash or check only but there is an atm available in the restaurant!

Great food! Very imaginative menu with many flavors and themes.  Seems very farm to table, with local foods and offerings.   Daily specials, it seems, that the staff seemed very knowledgeable on.  I will say, that they (as many other reviewers stated) that they are a cash establishment only. Nor do they split checks. This is noted on the very top on the menu. Starting your menu off with all the things you won't do just sets the tone for a negative experience. Re word it, or hey, better yet - take cards. You are charging enough to pay the fees. Or add a 3% convenience fee. Something.  Also, they do offer a dog friendly patio. With that being said, the couple seated next to us allowed their dog to meander under our table, sniff our feet and generally just be in our space. This is not the fault of the restaurant, but for all that is good and holy, control your dog. Honestly, this is for selfish reasons only, as I (as a dog owner) would like to see more dog friendly establishments and don't want to see the privilege ruined by assholes.  I would definitely visit this location again.

Possibly my favorite place in Madison; I can't say I had a regular spot, but this is as close as it gets. The burgers here are phenomenal -- large, not overcooked, with lots of inventive toppings -- but the food is quite good overall. They have a solid (and ever-changing) tap list, along with a couple good cocktails.  Alchemy isn't large, and the placement of the raised bar can make getting around awkward at times, but in general I've found this to be a supremely comfortable place to grab a meal and a beer. The servers and bartenders are always welcoming and attentive, and despite the weekend crowds, I've never felt rushed. It's cash-only of course, as many people have noted, but the ATM inside doesn't make it much of an inconvenience.  Not a whole lot I'd improve -- great casual food, nice atmosphere, and a lot of character.
Just stopped in and had a great lunch. This was my second time here and both times were very good.

Hands down: one of the best restaurants in Madison.  Their food is sourced locally, the chef's creations are delectable, the beer selection is top notch, and the ambiance is one of a kind. To be honest, I've never not liked anything I've tried, but here are some of my faves: the "batch bread with Pâté" is ALWAYS yummy, wasabi green beans are my fave side dish, the wings are the perfect amount of spicy, and their stuffed grilled cheese is delicious!

Love the local-ness of this little place.  Perfect for a date night and my go-to place to dine with Hubby in Madison!  I love the local ingredients used in the meals and the local bakery selections.  Its a pretty cozy place so you should be comfortable with that, and parking is a little iffy but well worth a little walk.  We would recommend almost everything on the menu!  Check it out!!  The only downfall is they don't accept credit cards, so plan ahead!

Great experience. Went on a late Tuesday night; there was live jazz by young musicians and a solid crowd. Ate sweet potato fries for appetizer; they were tasty without too much oil, and the side condiments were flavorful, especially the spicy/sweet jam. BBQ Pork entree was good if not a bit too juicy, but good flavor. Side salad was excellent with interesting combo of ingredients of dried apple pieces, radishes, onions, mixed greens, and a tasty vinaigrette. Would go again and would recommend for quality of food, atmosphere, and service.

My friends from Madison took me here promising good food and a great beer. Alchemy did not disappoint.   I had the stuffed grilled cheese that was wonderful and unique. I had the house salad on the side, which was just ok- the dressing was a little off- but the sandwich made up for it.   One friend had the ravioli special and the other had a great burger. We were all completely satisfied with our meal.   Beers were great too. I'll definitely make a trip back here on my next stop in Madison!   Cash only- but they have an ATM on site if needed.

I can't wait to go here again.  Unique beer selection, cozy environment and fantastic food!  I had the stuffed grilled cheese which was nothing short of heaven on a plate. Whoever came up with that combo needs an award of some sort. The wasabi green beans I picked as a side were good, but I'd opt for a salad next time.   My significant other had the fish fry which was probably my third favorite fish fry ever. (Behind The Fireside and Old Fashioned).  I am aware that these statements are bold, but this place is good. If you're nearby give it a try.

I had the burger. Very tasty. My husband had the ribs which he enjoyed. Unfortunately the place only takes cash and as we did not have enough cash on us when we walked in we were told we could use their atm which would charge us $1. When we went to retrieve our cash to pay our tab the atm was "out of bills" and I was told to walk down the block to get cash from an atm at another establishment. I was flabbergasted and told the staff that it was 2015 I could not understand why they did not have a back up plan besides making their customers walk down the street for cash. Needless to say we won't be returning.

Alchemy - Transforming simple ingredients into great meals  The dictionary defines alchemy as any magical power or process of transmuting a common substance, usually of little value, into a substance of great value.  That pretty much sums up how I felt about my recent lunch visit.   They transformed a group of simple ingredients (spare ribs, a roll, swiss cheese, some greens and mayo ) into a memorable dining experience that far exceeded my expectations from a bar and grill setting.    I visited Alchemy on a Sunday morning after a leisurely October bike ride.  As soon as I walked in I realized I used to frequent this location years ago when it did business as Wonder's Bar.  Frankly, not much has changed and that''s a good thing.  Back in the day, I was a fan of the elevated bar, all the rustic woodwork and lots of natural light and the new owners maintained all those features.  The tabletops were clean as were the floors.  The volume level  of the TV was a little too high for my liking, but most of the bar patrons were there to watch the Packer game, so that was expected.  Service was great as well.  Our server was energetic, friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.   The drink and food orders were delivered promptly and our server stayed on top of beverage refills.    I ordered one of the daily specials, the pulled spare rib sandwich.  It was a good concept that was well executed by the kitchen.  The tender spare ribs were moist without being greasy.   While I'm usually not a huge fan of tarragon, but I liked the hint of tarragon in the mayo. it worked well with the other ingredients.  The sandwich was topped with a handful of fresh watercress that added a nice textural contrast.  An the roll used for the sandwich was fresh and was in proper proportion to the fillings.  The sandwich came with a side of wasabi green beans which I thoroughly enjoyed.  I usually avoid green beans since they tend to be overcooked, but I appreciated the fact these beans had a little crunch to them.  The wasabi seeds were a nice accent to the dish.   I was expecting the wasabi to dominate the dish, but it did not.    I was a little disappointed in the much-hyped sweet potato fries.  I thought they were fried too long, so the natural sweetness of the potato was masked by a  bitter aftertaste.  Some of that bitterness was overcome by dipping the fried in the jalapeno - blackberry jam that accompanied this dish.  The tarragon mayo that worked so well with my sandwich did not work as well with the fries.    Overall, I was impressed with the food and service offered by Alchemy - definitely a step above the typical bar and grill experience.  I plan to return to try more of the menu items.

My favorite restaurant in Madison. The menu is creative and the drink selection is great. I come here every time I am in town and it never disappoints. The coconut curry veggies are great for vegetarians. The sweet potato fries are the best too.

Such a big fan of this place. One of my go to spots when my wife and I want to go out for a bite to eat.   Take note that it is cash only, they do have an ATM, so no need to go out of your way if you just want to come right to Alchemy from your house but have no cash.  The food here is spot on. Try anything, I mean that.   If you want some advice, try the wings & or sweet potato fries for an appetizer... you will not be disappointed. The spice and the flavor on the wings are right on point, even a little chocolaty. The dip for the fries will have you double dipping in no time.  Tinshack burger, portobello burger, grilled cheese w/ veggies are a few sandwiches to check out if that is your thing.   Try their special, whenever they have a special, just do yourself a favor and go for it.   If you aren't feeling the special then check out the Flank steak, ribs or fish tacos. Flavor for days.   Not to mention that this is a place that has a great atmosphere, w/ dim lighting that makes ya feel like you could just roll out of bed and stumble in for an amazing meal.   I even proposed to my wife at Alchemy. We moved away from Madison a couple years ago, but it is a place that we will always remember and reminisce about when thinking back on fun times in Madison. :)

Alchemy stands out in a sea of generic bars. The food is inventive, locally inspired, and well prepared. I've never had a bad meal here. All sandwiches are tasty, including the vegetarian options, and I love that I can pair them with the always high quality/fresh/more-than-your-average-side-salad "salad of the day." Over the years I've tried a few of the specials (pulled pork nachos and tilapia dinner come to mind) and they have not disappointed! Oh yeah, I should forget to mention the Midwest-centric craft beer on tap.  Be prepared to wait on a weekend evening and bring cash. It'll be worth it.

The alchemy was an adorable hippie-ish  restaurant with huge success.  Met a friend there for supper.  Ordered the vegetarian grilled cheese with chips and a salad and a lemonade.  The sandwich was magical with flavors marching together in perfect step...red onion, avocado, tomato, kale, mushrooms, and smoked Gouda cheese.  Salad came dressed in a sweet spicy vinaigrette dressing. Chips were thick and crisp and perfectly salted. The only bad thing was they don't take "plastic" like so many restaurants in the Marquette, so hit up the free ATM beforehand; there are a few in the neighborhood but they charge fees anywhere from $1.73-$3; or you'll be sweeping floors or doing dishes to work off your meal haha.  Will definitely come again.

This is such a warm friendly place with character located in a great neighborhood. You must come see for yourself! I had the burger special of the day which was great, the fries are amazing!! Highly recommend!

Great little pub! We sat outside on a Friday evening and were able to enjoy their little sidewalk patio with our dog. Our server was very friendly and attentive. Weren't hungry enough for appetizers, but the entrees my husband and I ordered were both great. I had the deluxe version of the applerum burger with a dilled potato salad on the side. The burger was SO good, definitely a fan of that habanero aioli! The potato salad was very good too and a decent size for a side portion. My husband went for the Friday fish fry special, which was fresh and not overly greasy. My glass of wine was only $5 so aside from everything being wonderful, the entire meal was super cheap too!

WHAT THE "H" MADISON? (I'll stop yelling.)  I'm not certain why the reviews for Alchemy aren't better, because they should be. Have you been there recently? Do you need to update a lackluster review? Do you need to write one because you love it and you haven't yet? Help these peeps out, more folks need to know about the awesomeness inside.   The place has (in my opinion of course) one of the best burgers on the Isthmus and their sweet potatoe fries/chips are out of this world good! You can sub the standard burger side for the sweet frites and they charge a nominal fee. It's worth it. The staff is simply delightful and the place serves the full menu pretty darn late.   Head there on a Thursday or Friday and you'll probably be treated to some tunes if you're there late enough. It gets loud, so know that if you're going in a group you'll be taking in the music more than the convo.   Parking sucks donkey balls but that's no reason to knock these guys. You'll have luck a little ways up on side streets.   So go.  Eat. Enjoy. Write.   I'm telling you, these guys deserve more credit than they're getting.

Every time we go here, I tell my dinnermates, "This is the type of place I want to own some day."  The fries are killer (sweet potato and regular)--definitely dip them in the tarragon mayo.  Every time I've ordered the special it's been fantastic.  The grilled cheese is probably the best grilled cheese that's ever happened in the history of grilled cheese (I recommend ordering it with bacon).  Don't get the steak--I've had two people say it sucks.  But everything else on the menu is damn worth it.  YES, it's cash only, and YES, that does catch you by surprise if you're not a regular (or sometimes if you are and you drink a lot, like I do)... but at least their ATM usually works.  Would definitely be 5 stars for food and service alike if it weren't for the cash only issue and the aforementioned subpar steak.

Alchemy is one solid joint in Madison. I've been twice and haven't had anything bad. Between the great food and the stellar service how can you not give it a five star review? Prices are reasonable and the atmosphere is perfect for being a neighborhood joint.   This particular visit we had the wings, french fries as well as enjoyed a few beers plus had the mushroom bisque. Wow was that soup good! Alchemy seems to always have a soup bubbling up in the kitchen and this weeks soup was no disappointment. As a matter of fact the entire lunch was excellent. I really wanted to order a burger too but being that we had dinner plans i couldn't stuff my face fully!   We will be back again, that is a given as our Madison framily only lives a couple of blocks away. As always I expect Alchemy to be serving up the goods correct as they should! Also the place only takes cash but don't fret they have an ATM that is only a whopping 1 dollar surcharge. Good job on that!

The menu has some interesting items. The dolamades were very good. I feel the have a unique style, although it is a subtle one and hard to place. The menu has a surprising variety that you wouldn't expect from a first glance. They were very accommodating to my vegan friend, although the choices for vegans are somewhat slim. It is definitely worth checking out and a good place for just chillin' with friends
This is a great place.  Very good food.  Bands and trivia and stuff there all the time.

Alchemy is one of my new favorite restaurants in town!   The food is delicious! I've tried the butternut squash soup (seasonal), butternut squash sandwich, wasabi green beans (yum!), sweet potato chips, portabella pate with grilled bread (unique, vegetarian, and yummy!). All food is delish!!!! They have fun coctails at decent prices, too, such as the Philosopher's Stone (run with ginger beer) and awesome Old Fashions.   Four stars because seating can be a challenge at times, especially if you have more than 4 people in your party.

Not too impressed with this new place. The staff tend to be young hipsters- eh.  Service leaves a bit to be desired, from my experience... A friend and I were all but ignored by a female bartender there recently. The music is often too loud to dine/converse comfortably. I don't really go to this place for beer- not when The Ideal is right next door.  UPDATE: After giving Alchemy numerous chances- and even though the food can be really good sometimes-  I GIVE UP! The service SUCKS. Snotty, inattentive, and downright RUDE. I am done with it. One star from me at this point.

This was a cute place to go on a Wednesday night for date night. It wasn't too busy, but busy enough that you know people enjoy it here. They have a nice selection of craft beer on tap that many places in town don't have. I got a lavender honey ale and it was good. My partner had a buffalo Mac and cheese that he loved--I think they undersold how spicy it was though! If you like spice I recommend! I had a stuffed grilled cheese, which wasn't really stuffed it was more just bread with cheese and a pile of raw vegetables on top. I had fries with it but their fries were nothing special. I think this place was good, but I wasn't blown away by their food. I like to go to a place where they make something I couldn't make or I wouldn't have thought of and this did not impress me in that regard.

When I first moved to the Atwood area, I actively avoided eating at the Alchemy. It just seemed so hipster and was likely to be incredibly overrated as everyone kept telling me "it's the best".  Almost all of our friends somewhat regularly hang out at the Ideal, so naturally the Alchemy is an easy and convenient choice for post beverage eating. The first time I went, I ordered The Matilda which is a sandwich with squash and some other stuff on it. I was NOT impressed. I didn't think it was good at all and the restaurant is a little pricey so I was especially disappointed.  Some years went by when I flat out refused to eat there and give in to the hype of a not even good restaurant - which I feel happens with A LOT of restaurants in Madison and I avoid them.  Eventually, I gave in. My fiance loves the Alchemy and he ALWAYS wanted to eat there. I decided to give it another chance. This time I ordered the steak. It was fabulous. The restaurant wasn't insanely busy and the service was great and quick.  We literally go there ALL. THE. TIME. now. Seriously. At least once every two weeks. Now I pretty much always order the flank steak. It comes with a seasonal vegetable and mashed potatoes. The vegetables so far since I started going back have been Brussels sprouts with some kind of delicious sauce and now it's collard greens with bacon. Both are absolutely DELICIOUS. Cooked perfectly almost every time and just so dang good! The steak is always awesome no matter how I order it cooked. Mashed potatoes are legit my favorite food in the world so you can't really go wrong there.  ALSO, Tuesday is $12 bottle of wine night. That's right. A whole bottle. $12. (The organic wines are $15 but still a heck of a deal!). We go there on A LOT of Tuesdays.  All in all, I was so skeptical of the Alchemy. I gave it a chance and it disappointed me. I gave it another chance, and it is now one of my absolute FAVORITE restaurants in Madison. I love it!

Yelp, yelp, yelp.  Sometimes you really need to have a half star option, because this place is really 3.5 stars in my book.  Three seems too little, four too much.  I've been hearing good things about Alchemy for years, and finally made it out there for a business lunch last week.  Service was a little slow and disorganized.  We sat for a while before anyone came around with waters, and then almost simultaneously two waitresses showed up to greet us and with glasses of water.  Neither asked if we were ready to order, and both disappeared just as quickly.  It was a while longer before our server returned to take our order.  This being my first time, I asked the server for a recommendation out of a couple of items and she wholeheartedly recommended the BLFT.  There are a lot of things to like about the sandwich.
