The fried tomato lends a nice warmth to the traditional BLT, but tasted more like oil than tomato.  The aoli, which I was concerned would be overpowering, was much more subtle and blended into the overall taste quite well.  The fries were something special.  No one came by to refill our waters, and when I asked for more it took long enough for someone to return with a pitcher that we had finished our meals by then.  We were brought the wrong bill, but our server noticed (I didn't), and fixed it for us - it then took a long time for our server to pick up our payment and bring change.  Alchemy seems like a great fit for the neighborhood, and I'd definitely go back, but so far it's not top of my list.

The great and interesting burgers drew me to Alchemy. After eating here many times, I've discovered that they do a great job with their food in general. I've been consistently surprised at their ability to do great with many different types of food.
This place has amazing food and great live music. I highly recommend the bison burger and sweet potato fries. They don't charge a cover but come with cash because they don't accept cards.

The Tinhouse burger, the soup, the beer, the atmosphere are awesome but take a back seat to the amazing fries!   I haven't had fries like that since I was a kid! Service was great, food was great and came out quick.  I'm definitely putting this on my "places to eat" list!

WE LOVE ALCHEMY!  I've only been here to listen to live bluegrass music a couple evenings, but every visit has been pleasant! They have a really good beer selection and delicious food. The sweet potato fries were great and their batch bakery grilled bread is worth coming back for.  Alchemy definitely has a local "feel" to it with a lot of personality.

This is an incredibly overrated place. It's pretentious and the food is garbage. I've never had so many people recommend such a below average place in my life. I don't understand how anyone could think anything on the menu is at all above average. I've been there several times and paid for disappointing food every single time. And the people that work there are pretentious little bitches too, sorry for being so frank but I can't come up with more accurate words. The overrated alchemy is worthless, so don't even bother. You will only find douchebags and disappointing food accompanied by an incredibly uncreative and bland beer and drink menu.

Great place for a laid back dinner. The food is always good and they have a nice cocktail menu. It's small, cozy and a bit dark. They also have a bar if you are just interested in a drink. I know they do some live music as well, but I haven't been there for that. Alchemy is always a good option and someplace pretty much everyone can find something they'll love.

This dive is amazing. I do not write many reviews but this place is fantastic. First the wait staff. We showed up early for a dinner with friends and sat at the bar. Drinks were priced competitively. The alchemy accommodated a party of 9 without hesitation. The wait staff serving the table was fast, friendly, and efficient. The food even though it was busy was quick and delicious. I had the bison burger. The burger was cooked to my order of medium and topped with fresh ingredients. The fries were fresh cut and excellent. I also recommend the clam soup. The Alchemy makes a great mid town dinning experience and I will return.

I enjoyed my Alchemy experience so much I've been twice in the past week....despite the cold and rain I had to walk through!  Not only is it a great bar, but the food is amazing...so much better than the average bar food you'll find at other places.  We've brought out of town friends here a couple of times so far and everyone thinks it is great!  Last night I had the hanger steak with rosemary red wine reduction and blue cheese....SO GOOD I've been craving that dish ever since.  The atmosphere is great-with the mirrors it looks much better than it really is but it has the cozy local feel that make you want to come again and again.  I'm really glad I found a new local spot to return to again and again!  #yelpnewvember

If you are reading this review it means you probably haven't been to the Alchemy yet.  Quit reading and get over there! The Alchemy is a great place to try a new heady micro brew and to get a delicious meal filled with locally sourced ingredients.  The tap list is always changing and there is always a special to try. The Alchemy is also a good spot for late night music.  The groups they book are phenomenal.  The only downside is because of their strange, multi-teered floor plan, its not much fun when it is really busy.  Still, the Alchemy is 5 stars and the sweet potato fries  are a must!  "Hey Alchemy, what you cookin in the back? Sweet potato fries with no trans-fat!" ~The Mustache

Finally at the famous Alchemy, which is recommended by every friend who have been here before. They have GREAT burgers. The ingredients are all so fresh and wonderfully mixed together in flavor and texture.

The food at this place rocks! and it is consistent. We've been going there  regularly for a few years now and never had a bad meal. Service is usually very fast and efficient albeit not so friendly. Place can be loud when busy so don't expect to have a meaningful conversation but the food is a great value for the price. It's also one of the few places in this area that serves food after 11 PM.
Great sweet potato fries. Good other stuff. Open late, so it's really convenient. Often quite loud.

I have frequented the Alchemy for about 4 years now and have tried at least half the menu, as well as various specials they've offered.  I've never had a bad dish.  The sweet potato fries with tarragon mayo and jalapeno blackberry jam are an absolute must.  The wasabi beans are the perfect amount of spicy-hot.  They always have a fresh selection of microbrews on tap and every server we've had has been knowledgeable about them all. The muddled cranberry mojito and the Philospher's Stone (somewhat similar to a moscow mule) are my favorite cocktails they offer. The one item I have not explored much are the desserts they offer.  However, I can speak on the rest of their menu, and every dish we've had has been delicious and prepared with care.    Some things to note - Alchemy often has live music starting at around 9 or 10 at night.  It tends to get quite busy by about 7 o clock.  They are cash-only; they do have an ATM which charges a nominal $1 fee, but sometimes it's out of order.  The ATM across the street at the Stop-N-Go charges $2.25, so it pays to hit up a cheaper ATM beforehand!
The cocktail selection is very fun. The food is such a great price for the quality and quantity! There is a nice variety of vegetarian and carnivorous. The atmosphere is warm and cozy.

Great, lots of locally sourced ingredients, full menu available late at night, quirky/vegan/veg/foodie options, nice atmosphere. With the exception of the Friday night DJ who was super excited to bring reggae culture to the forefront and who played Shaggy for an 8th grade flashback, this place is a must visit. Fair warning, and I did know ahead of time, but just to pass it on, they don't take cards, so bring cash.

One of my favorites in Madison.  Went recently and got the grilled cheese and butternut squash soup. Both quite tasty. Would recommend either if you go.  Service was prompt and friendly. The bartender was extra friendly. I got a mimosa and they gave me the tiny bottle as a sidecar!  I was a little weary about going hear knowing how much I love the Owl next door, but this place was just as great!

Went to Alchemy today because my friend was craving a burger. I had never dined here before, but she had and suggested it. I was thoroughly impressed. She had the bison burger which was to die for, I had a bite and instantly wanted another. I ordered the BLFT and it was loaded with bacon and flavor. I had some minor issues with it, first being that there was just a little too much aioli on the bread and second that the fried tomato was a red tomato and not a green tomato. I just found the texture of the tomato unappetizing. I also enjoyed their bloody mary and they have a nice local, craft beer selection. For dessert we had the espresso torte and it was one of the best I have ever had. Service was also spot on and I will be returning soon to get the bison burger for myself!

Haven't had a bad experience at Alchemy. What I like the most is for the price of what your paying to what you get. The quality of there food is so good and everything is delicious. I can't believe I only pay $14 for their hanger steak entrée. They could easily charge more and other restaurants probably do.  Besides their hanger steak they have excellent burgers and sandwiches. Last time we were there my husband and I shared a salad. I forget the name but it had a ton of veggies and garbanzo beans with sweet and tangy dressing. They also have a good selection of beers and cocktails.  They also have nightly specials but come early because they often sell out. Its a smaller space so sometimes there is a wait but definitely worth it. You can sit at the bar and kinda see into the kitchen which is fun to watch too.

Had the Bella sandwich and Alchemy fries. It was fabulous! I will definitely return...maybe tomorrow...and I live in Green Bay...yeah, it's that good. My only complaint is that they don't take credit.

Pricey! But the food was sooooooo good!!!!!! Again another one of those places in Madison which are good to go once in a while.  Update: We went here again last weekend and yet again the food was YUMMMM!!!! Pricey as usual but delicious delicious food! Different menu than the first time we went. When asked for previous items waitress mentioned menu changed for Friday because of small kitchen and small fryer (I am surprised by the fast service with a small kitchen!) Well, we got to try new items on their menu. Very crowded and very very loud and dim lighting but it was lovely ambience. I didn't mind the noise.  I wish the staff smiled more. Both times staff rarely smiled but the service was good. Only setback they accept only cash.

I friggin' love Alchemy.  The one downside is that they are very frequently busy, which is okay, because that gives you time to go over to One Barrel Brewing.  Their food is thoughtfully coordinated and their prices are pretty low considering the quality.  (I think one of the ways they keep prices low is by only accepting cash.)  The beer list is usually very strong.  I'd be lying if I said that the atmosphere didn't play a role in my ardor for this spot.  The restaurant is mostly older wood (bar, tables, floor), and very intimate and dark.  There are a few windows for natural light, but for the most part it is very cozy.  I totally recommend going and getting the buffalo wings (not available on Fridays because of the Fish Fry)!!!!

This place has arguably the best sweet potato friends in Madison!!!  Happened to be in the neighborhood so we decided to stop for a late lunch and my husband had the brisket sandwich which was great, but those fries...seriously!  Decent craft beer selection and the stepped height seating areas in the restaurant are fun to people watch!  Glad we stopped!

This place has a lot of things going for it. To name a few: - One of the best fish fry dishes in town. Very filling and they make an amazing breading - Dishes I've had have all been good: The reuben is made with brisket and kimchi which make a stellar combination. The salad selection is limited but solid. Don't skip the fries if you like the thin-crispy style pseudo-chips with a house-made ketchup. - Beer selection is varied in palate and diverse in origin, with a loving nod to some of the midwest breweries of renown.  - Live music is always pleasant. The space's acoustics lend themselves to the jazz quartet we heard there. - Patio in the hippest part of Madison (in my opinion) - Nice bar (one barrel) and divey bar (ideal bar) nearby while you wait for a table - Friendly service and a good crowd. - Quiet enough for a conversation, the atmosphere is 'chill'   Cons: - Cash only, but they have an ATM - Often crowded, see my comment about nearby bars for waiting - A bit dark at night. Doesn't bother me but my girlfriend likes the brighter tables  Overall a great spot. They have me hooked.

Stumbled upon here from Yelp reviews and I was not disappointed. Thanks, my fellow Yelpers! There were a lot of pictures and tips to get the BLFT and/or stuffed grilled cheese, but I'm a man who needs his meat!   Instead, I went with the grilled chicken breast sammich, called the House Boat.The House boat had this extremely flaky fluffy bread, too flaky for me, but then again, I'm more of a unleavened bread type of person. The House Boat was served with jalapeno relish, tomato, greens and gorgonzola. I got the habenero basil aioli on the side, along with their house fries, which resembled more like potato chips -- not crunchy, or soggy. It's weird -- when it comes to chips, I like em generally crunchy, kettle-styled. Regardless, the sandwich was very tasty.  They have a small outdoor dining area, three small tables, and are dog-friendly. Food came out fast, service was really good and informative, and overall, a pretty nice lunch dining experience.  BATHROOM REVIEW: Located past the kitchen, the mens bathroom consisted of a few urinals and stalls. Decently lit, and clean, the bathroom did it's job. SIt or squat? Squat.

I really like Alchemy. I've been coming here on and off for several years now, and I can honestly say I have never had a bad experience.   Some of the low reviews, especially the folks upset about Alchemy being "cash only" really surprise me. I guess those who are not familiar with the area might find the "cash only" strange, however, anyone who frequents the Atwood/Willy neighborhood would know that this is pretty standard practice. Players, Harmony, The Ideal, Mr. Roberts, Mickey's, Crystal Corner, (to name a few) are all cash only establishments. It's just this area of town.   But back to Alchemy. YUM! Everything I have ever tried here has been delicious. A few favorites include: -Stuffed Grilled Cheese (sans cilantro) -BBQ Pork  -Buffalo Wings -House Fries  The atmosphere is usually somewhat upbeat whenever I am there. Live music periodically which is fun. The live music does tend to drown out all chances of a nice conversation, which can be slightly annoying. When there is room, I like to sit up at the bar. It's elevated and gives you a nice vantage over the whole place. The bartenders have always been great, and the cocktails always tasty! Service has always been speedy, as well.   The inside of the building itself is quite interesting. Multi-level dining room almost gives it a snug feel. Woodwork is nice. Skylights let in lots of natural light. Rotating artwork from local artists. Overall, I really like what they have done with the space.   Only downfall is sometimes finding parking can be a challenge. That's minor though.

I am a huge fan of the Matilida.  Last time I got it, it was a little short on the squash and amazing gorgonzola herb dressing, but still a great sandwich. I've tried a significant amount of food from their menu, and it's all very fresh, very well prepared and creative.  I would recommend this place to anyone looking for affordable, quality food.  Their winter fries: purple potato are unbeatable.  I love them so much, I've attempted duplicating the recipe at home. The secret is malt vinegar and salt overnight, so I've been told.  Great dips, great appetizers, good dessert.  Affordable specials, nice atmosphere.  If you are in a rush, go at an odd hours, this place can get busy during peak eating hours.  One of my go-to spots when I'm in Madison.  Definitely recommended.
Nice atmosphere. Friendly service. There's a bar, but it has a restaurant feel to it. Skylights and plenty of windows keep it well lit. Pleasant outside seating. Delicious and unique foods.

Just got home from dinner. We tried the raved about sweet potato fries, really good! Whoever thought of pairing the jam: brilliant! I had the wings. Wow! Really different, and really good! HUGE wings, which I generally don't love, but the flavor is fabulous! Took quite a few home too. Hubby had the perch tacos. He wasn't as pleased with his meal as I was. He said they were ok. Got the flourless chocolate cake to go, haven't tried it yet, but it looks right.. We will return. I want to try the flank steak...
